itemMeta.title: KnowledgeItem delivering one or more concepts requested from the IPTC Concept Resolution System

concept.name: arts, culture and entertainment
concept.definition: Matters pertaining to the advancement and refinement of the human mind, of interests, skills, tastes and emotions

concept.name: archaeology
concept.definition: Probing the past through ruins and artefacts

concept.name: architecture
concept.definition: Designing of buildings, monuments and the spaces around them

concept.name: bullfighting
concept.definition: Classical contest pitting man against the bull

concept.name: festive event (including carnival)
concept.definition: Parades, parties, celebrations and the like not necessarily tied to a fixed occasion or date

concept.name: cinema
concept.definition: Stories related to cinema as art and entertainment

concept.name: film festival
concept.definition: Stories about national and international motion pictures festivals, selections, festival juries, nominations, awards etc.

concept.name: dance
concept.definition: The expression of emotion or message through movement

concept.name: fashion
concept.definition: The design of clothing and accessories

concept.name: jewelry
concept.definition: Accessories to clothing

concept.name: language
concept.definition: The means by which people communicate with each other

concept.name: library and museum
concept.definition: Edifices used to house collections of books, music, art, or objects from the past and present for public use and display

concept.name: literature
concept.definition: The use of pamphlets, books or other printed matter to convey ideas, stories or other messages for the public

concept.name: fiction
concept.definition: Structured stories that are usually not based on fact but are the creation of the authors imagination

concept.name: poetry
concept.definition: The art, structure, forms of poetic expression

concept.name: music
concept.definition: Expressing emotion or message through instruments or voice using different sounds, tones, harmonies and the like

concept.name: classical music
concept.definition: Music that follows classic structures of rhythm and harmony

concept.name: folk music
concept.definition: Music that developed from folk cultures, often based on story-telling

concept.name: jazz music
concept.definition: A music of diverse harmonics, often improvised

concept.name: popular music
concept.definition: The latest fad in music, generally aimed at the younger generation

concept.name: country music
concept.definition: Similar to folk but is unique to the United States and is less about story telling than about loves sought and lost

concept.name: rock and roll music
concept.definition: Popular dance music developed in the 1950s

concept.name: painting
concept.definition: Using the mediums of oils, watercolour, pastel, pencils, chalk, crayon etc on various grounds to express emotion or message

concept.name: photography
concept.definition: Mechanical means of creating images of objects by use of light and light sensitive materials with chemicals or by digitals means

concept.name: radio
concept.definition: Stories related to radio as art and entertainment

concept.name: sculpture
concept.definition: Representation of forms in clays, stone, woods, metals or other materials

concept.name: plastic art
concept.definition: Forms of hand created art including installations

concept.name: television
concept.definition: Stories related to television as art and entertainment

concept.name: theatre
concept.definition: Telling of a story or idea through dialogue, music and physical expression in a space or building designed for it

concept.name: music theatre
concept.definition: Opera, operetta, music revues etc

concept.name: monument and heritage site
concept.definition: Areas containing commemorative objects for historical people or events

concept.name: institution-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Either an established law, practice or system or an organization having a social, religious, educational or similar purpose such as hospital, school, prison
concept.note: DEPRECATED in V 14 - term moved to 04018001

concept.name: customs and tradition
concept.definition: A particular way of behaving, or observances that have developed over time by a group of people

concept.name: arts (general)
concept.definition: The collective expression of message or emotion through music, literature, painting, theatre or other means

concept.name: entertainment (general)
concept.definition: The collective use of television, radio, theatre, music and the like for the amusement of people

concept.name: culture (general)
concept.definition: The ideas, customs, arts, skills of a particular group

concept.name: cultural development
concept.definition: The history of the development of art and culture such as the rise of cave paintings, pre-Colombian art, Chinese paper-making, anything non-political

concept.name: nightclub
concept.definition: A commercial establishment providing music, or other entertainment along with food and drink to selected clientele

concept.name: cartoon
concept.definition: Still images such as editorial cartoons and comic strips

concept.name: animation
concept.definition: Animation, including full-length and short cinema, artists and merchandising of goods featuring animation characters.

concept.name: mass media
concept.definition: Television, radio, magazines, newspapers etc

concept.name: periodicals
concept.definition: Written material that is usually published weekly, bi-weekly, monthly or annually for a long time

concept.name: news media
concept.definition: Television, wire services, radio that collect facts about incidents, developing and presenting them to audiences as a whole story

concept.name: newspapers
concept.definition: Daily or weekly publications that present the day to day history of the world, as well as features, comics etc

concept.name: reviews
concept.definition: A critical look at someone else's work, whether film, theatre or writing

concept.name: internet
concept.definition: Stories related to Internet as art and entertainment

concept.name: crime, law and justice
concept.definition: Establishment and/or statement of the rules of behaviour in society, the enforcement of these rules, breaches of the rules and the punishment of offenders. Organizations and bodies involved in these activities.

concept.name: crime
concept.definition: Violation of established laws by individuals, companies or organizations

concept.name: homicide
concept.definition: Killing of one person by another

concept.name: computer crime
concept.definition: Theft or destructive behaviour using a computer

concept.name: theft
concept.definition: Unlawful taking

concept.name: drug trafficking
concept.definition: Dealing in illicit often harmful substances

concept.name: sexual assault
concept.definition: Sexual battery of one sex against another

concept.name: assault (general)
concept.definition: Battery, slugfests, brawls and threatening behaviour

concept.name: kidnapping
concept.definition: To seize and detain or carry away a person against that person's will by unlawful threat, force or fraud

concept.name: arson
concept.definition: Intentional setting of fires with criminal intent

concept.name: gang activity
concept.definition: Criminal activities by groups of individuals, usually in urban areas, who are allied by common territories, languages, ethnic backgrounds but generally are loosely organized.

concept.name: judiciary (system of justice)
concept.definition: The system set up to deal with crime and those who do them

concept.name: lawyer
concept.definition: Anyone legally able to represent another person or entity in a legal matter, such as a lawyer, solicitor, barrister, procurator, notary.

concept.name: judge
concept.definition: Members of the bench that sit in judgement

concept.name: court administration
concept.definition: Court clerks, bailiffs, stenographers etc.

concept.name: police
concept.definition: Agents of the legal system set up enforce the laws

concept.name: law enforcement
concept.definition: Agencies involved in attempts to prevent disobedience to established laws, or to bring to justice those that disobey those laws

concept.name: investigation
concept.definition: Process of inquiry of a possible crime up to the point of arrest

concept.name: arrest
concept.definition: Detention of a suspect of a crime

concept.name: punishment
concept.definition: The retribution handed out to those who break the laws

concept.name: fine
concept.definition: Monetary punishment

concept.name: prison
concept.definition: Also know as jails, lockups, calaboose, etc. for keeping law breakers from society

concept.name: laws
concept.definition: The codification of rules of behaviour

concept.name: criminal
concept.definition: The criminal code system

concept.name: civil
concept.definition: The civil code system

concept.name: justice and rights
concept.definition: The equitable administration of laws and regulations

concept.name: civil rights
concept.definition: Rights of individuals under civil law

concept.name: trials
concept.definition: The process by which guilt or innocence, or right or wrong is determined and adjudged

concept.name: litigation
concept.definition: Taking disputed issues to court for settlement by judge and/or jury

concept.name: arbitration
concept.definition: Resolution of disputed issues by a neutral panel

concept.name: court preliminary
concept.definition: Pre-trial events including pleas, bail, motions, discovery, depositions.

concept.name: prosecution
concept.definition: Stories regarding activities and investigations by public prosecutors.

concept.name: defendant
concept.definition: The person on trial

concept.name: witness
concept.definition: A person who testifies

concept.name: organized crime
concept.definition: Crimes committed by gangs or criminal groups.

concept.name: international law
concept.definition: The system of laws embraced by all nations, such as the Geneva Convention, the International Law of the Seas, etc.

concept.name: international court or tribunal
concept.definition: The activities of international tribunals such as European court for human rights, Hague tribunal, International Court of Justice etc

concept.name: extradition
concept.definition: Legal transfer of criminals or suspects between countries

concept.name: corporate crime
concept.definition: Misdeeds of corporations and corporate officers

concept.name: fraud
concept.definition: Intentional deception that causes others to give up rights or property

concept.name: embezzlement
concept.definition: The intentional theft of money left in one's care

concept.name: restraint of trade
concept.definition: Interference in free competition in business and trade

concept.name: breach of contract
concept.definition: Rupture of legal agreements between companies, and with customers

concept.name: anti-trust crime
concept.definition: Violations of laws against monopolies

concept.name: corruption
concept.definition: General business misbehaviour

concept.name: bribery
concept.definition: Payments or benefits to influence the outcome of a legal case

concept.name: war crime
concept.definition: Crimes committed during a war or armed conflict, usually against civilians or POW's, including the prosecution of such crimes

concept.name: disaster and accident
concept.definition: Man made and natural events resulting in loss of life or injury to living creatures and/or damage to inanimate objects or property.

concept.name: drought
concept.definition: A severe lack of water over a period of time

concept.name: earthquake
concept.definition: The shifting of the tectonic plates of the Earth, creating in some cases damage to structures

concept.name: famine
concept.definition: Severe lack of food for a large population

concept.name: fire
concept.definition: Ignition and consumption of materials through a combination of high heat and oxygen

concept.name: flood
concept.definition: Surfeit of water, caused by heavy rains or melting snow, usually in places where it's not wanted

concept.name: industrial accident
concept.definition: A mishap in a factory, a shop or an office, potentially harmful to humans

concept.name: structural failures
concept.definition: When a building, bridge or other structures collapse because of unexpected forces or poor design

concept.name: meteorological disaster
concept.definition: A weather-related disaster

concept.name: windstorms
concept.definition: A storm of high velocity but non-hurricane force movements of air with little or no rain or hail. Often highly destructive

concept.name: nuclear accident
concept.definition: A mishap involving radioactive materials

concept.name: pollution
concept.definition: Emissions of unwanted materials in areas where it can be harmful

concept.name: transport accident
concept.definition: An accident involving one or more vehicles

concept.name: road accident
concept.definition: Accidents on roads.

concept.name: railway accident
concept.definition: Accidents involving trains.

concept.name: air and space accident
concept.definition: Accidents involving craft in air or space.

concept.name: maritime accident
concept.definition: Accidents involving marine vessels.

concept.name: volcanic eruption
concept.definition: A rupture in the skin of the Earth allowing molten material to escape to the surface

concept.name: relief and aid organisation
concept.definition: Organizations set up to provide help to those in need because of lack of food, water or shelter

concept.name: accident (general)
concept.definition: Any unplanned event that causes unwanted consequences

concept.name: emergency incident
concept.definition: A sudden, unexpected event that requires immediate action

concept.name: explosion
concept.definition: Sudden eruptions, usually of chemical substances

concept.name: disaster (general)
concept.definition: Serious or sudden misfortune

concept.name: natural disasters
concept.definition: Destructive incidents caused by the very nature of nature -- hurricanes, earthquakes, floods etc

concept.name: avalanche/landslide
concept.definition: Sudden dislodging of massive amounts of snow or soil.

concept.name: emergency planning
concept.definition: Planning for actions to deal with sudden, unplanned events

concept.name: economy, business and finance
concept.definition: All matters concerning the planning, production and exchange of wealth.

concept.name: agriculture
concept.definition: The process of producing natural materials for consumption

concept.name: arable farming
concept.definition: Production of food in the ground

concept.name: fishing industry
concept.definition: Raising or gathering of fish

concept.name: forestry and timber
concept.definition: Production and collection and preparation of wood products for future use

concept.name: livestock farming
concept.definition: Raising of animals for food

concept.name: viniculture
concept.definition: Production of wines from the vines to the finish products

concept.name: aquaculture
concept.definition: Growing plants or animals in water for human consumption

concept.name: chemicals
concept.definition: Natural or manmade materials used to produce other materials

concept.name: biotechnology
concept.definition: The business of using engineering technology to study and solved problems of living organisms

concept.name: fertiliser
concept.definition: Natural or manmade materials used to encourage the growth of plants

concept.name: health and beauty product
concept.definition: Compilation of chemicals and other substances for use in enhancing ones looks or smell

concept.name: inorganic chemical
concept.definition: The branch of chemistry dealing with minerals and metals

concept.name: organic chemical
concept.definition: The branch of chemistry dealing with human, animal or carbon-based substances

concept.name: pharmaceutical
concept.definition: The production of medicines from various chemicals and natural substances

concept.name: synthetic and plastic
concept.definition: Chemicals used to produce plastics and other artificial substances to be used in manufacturing

concept.name: computing and information technology
concept.definition: Anything to do with the computing and/or transmission of information from one point to another.

concept.name: hardware
concept.definition: The physical devices used to provide computer services, such as monitors, hard drives, keyboards etc. but can also be used for equipment such as routers, servers and other network devices.

concept.name: networking
concept.definition: The interconnectivity between hardware that provides the medium for the transmission of data.

concept.name: satellite technology
concept.definition: Hardware and software that enables groundbased devices to send signals to each other via an orbiting satellite.

concept.name: semiconductors and active components
concept.definition: The basic components that together create working electronic devices such as computers

concept.name: software
concept.definition: Programming sets that, when installed on hardware, perform specified functions.

concept.name: telecommunication equipment
concept.definition: Devices such as telephone sets, voice/data switches, modems etc that facilitate point-to-point voice/data transmissions

concept.name: telecommunication service
concept.definition: Services provided by commercial companies that facilitate connections between telephones, pagers, computers

concept.name: security
concept.definition: To encompass technical developments in hardware and software, basic research and related areas such as cyber security

concept.name: wireless technology
concept.definition: Transmission of information through means other than point-to-point wired hookups

concept.name: construction and property
concept.definition: All items pertaining to the construction and sale of property

concept.name: heavy construction
concept.definition: Large scale construction projects, construction of roads, dams, office/factory buildings, offshore and onshore structures, large sport stadiums

concept.name: house building
concept.definition: Construction of residences, for private use

concept.name: real estate
concept.definition: The buying and selling of properties of all types

concept.name: farms
concept.definition: Agricultural areas for the production of foodstuffs, including dairy products, fruits and livestock, such as cattle and fish

concept.name: land price
concept.definition: The price of land in specific zoned areas such as commercial, residential arable as provided by a responsible body
concept.note: In Japan, government publishes lists of standard land prices every year as an economic barometer and Newspapers take up with a lot of space.

concept.name: renovation
concept.definition: Restoring properties/structures to a former better state by cleaning, repairing or rebuilding.

concept.name: design and engineering
concept.definition: Design and planning by Engineers, Architects etc. of roads, offices, factories, dams , offshore structures,

concept.name: energy and resource
concept.definition: Production of electrical power, and the water, air, sunlight, and fuels used to produce them

concept.name: alternative energy
concept.definition: Stories about the alternative energy business

concept.name: coal
concept.definition: Production and mining of anthracite and bituminous products for use in power production

concept.name: oil and gas - downstream activities
concept.definition: All matters concerning oil and gas, typically refining and distribution activities

concept.name: oil and gas - upstream activities
concept.definition: All matters concerning oil and gas, typically supply chain activities from the reservoir to the refinery gate

concept.name: nuclear power
concept.definition: Use of radioactive materials for power production

concept.name: electricity production and distribution
concept.definition: Primarily concerning the power line distribution system, but also the sale of electrical power at wholesale and retail levels

concept.name: waste management and pollution control
concept.definition: Stories about the business of waste management and pollution control

concept.name: water supply
concept.definition: Stories about the business of providing water for human use

concept.name: natural resources (general)
concept.definition: Articles about the general use of natural resources for business purposes, not focused on specific resources such as coal, oil, gas or water

concept.name: energy (general)
concept.definition: Articles about the energy industry, not focused on any specific sector

concept.name: natural gas
concept.definition: A natural resource, mainly methane in an flammable gaseous state, from the ground

concept.name: petrol
concept.definition: Distilled petroleum product used for automotive fuel, with or without additives

concept.name: diesel fuel
concept.definition: A distilled petroleum product heavier than gasoline used not only for trucks, marine engines, but in certain forms for home heating

concept.name: kerosene/paraffin
concept.definition: A light petroleum distillate used for cooking fuel, aircraft jet engines, lamps, heating and cleaning

concept.name: financial and business service
concept.definition: Services that transmit, safeguard, keep track of money or provide backup to commercial enterprises

concept.name: accountancy and auditing
concept.definition: Services provide balance sheet, budgets reconciliation and examine accuracy of financial statements

concept.name: banking
concept.definition: Services for storing, transmitting, receiving and delivery of cash moneys

concept.name: consultancy service
concept.definition: Providers of expert knowledge in a wide range of fields usually on a temporary, contract basis

concept.name: employment agency
concept.definition: A service helping people find jobs, and companies to find workers

concept.name: healthcare provider
concept.definition: Providers of medical services at all levels, including doctors, hospitals etc

concept.name: insurance
concept.definition: A risk taking venture that allows individuals to pay small amounts periodically to guard financially against unexpected events

concept.name: legal service
concept.definition: Lawyers and others who help companies and individuals deal with state, federal and local laws

concept.name: market research
concept.definition: A service that tries to determine what people want to buy

concept.name: stock broking
concept.definition: The buying and selling of company shares on behalf of individuals or other entities

concept.name: personal investing
concept.definition: Personal finance and investment

concept.name: market trend
concept.definition: Statistically significant consumer behaviour.

concept.name: shipping service
concept.definition: Companies that prepare and transport packages and documents for individuals or companies by any means, including postal services.

concept.name: personal service
concept.definition: Consumer service that is intangible e.g. beauty care as in hairdressing

concept.name: janitorial service
concept.definition: Companies that provide cleaning and similar services for homes and businesses.

concept.name: funeral parlour and crematorium
concept.definition: Companies that provide services for disposal of the dead

concept.name: rental service
concept.definition: Companies which provide rentals, including motor vehicles, tuxedos, tools, heavy equipment, and other supplies

concept.name: wedding service
concept.definition: Services and products related to the wedding industry

concept.name: personal finance
concept.definition: An individual's income and expenses

concept.name: personal income
concept.definition: Money that a person earns and is his/hers to keep or spend

concept.name: auction service
concept.definition: Sales by bidding

concept.name: printing/promotional service
concept.definition: Production of printed matter such as flyers, ads, signs etc

concept.name: investment service
concept.definition: Financial advisers, as opposed to stock dealers or consultants

concept.name: consumer goods
concept.definition: Items produced for and sold to individuals

concept.name: clothing
concept.definition: Items of apparel to wear

concept.name: department store
concept.definition: Stores largely devoted to the sale of clothing to individuals

concept.name: food
concept.definition: Fruits, vegetables, breads, meats for human consumption

concept.name: mail order
concept.definition: Items sold through and delivered by mail

concept.name: retail
concept.definition: The last stage in the sales chain

concept.name: speciality store
concept.definition: Retail outlets that specialize in categories such as shoes, coats, power tools, etc

concept.name: wholesale
concept.definition: The first link in the sales chain after production

concept.name: beverage
concept.definition: Liquid consumables, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic

concept.name: electronic commerce
concept.definition: Buying and selling items through the Internet

concept.name: luxury good
concept.definition: Leather bags, jewellery, haute couture, accessories etc

concept.name: non-durable good
concept.definition: Lighters, pens and stationery, tableware, watches, glasses etc

concept.name: toy
concept.definition: Children's plaything

concept.name: macro economics
concept.definition: Broad scale economics and the world or national level

concept.name: central bank
concept.definition: A country's major bank that sets interest rates, and provides transfer of funds between commercial banks

concept.name: consumer issue
concept.definition: Those issues, such as prices, inflation/deflation, quality of goods, at the retail sales level

concept.name: debt market
concept.definition: Market for trading debt instruments such as bonds, CDs, bankers acceptances, T bills, notes, IOUs etc

concept.name: economic indicator
concept.definition: Certain indexes, such as company inventories, the movement of prices that show whether the economy is improving or declining

concept.name: emerging market
concept.definition: Those markets that are struggling to enter the world economies and those requiring financial help from international lenders

concept.name: foreign exchange market
concept.definition: The trading of shekels, dinars, euros dollars etc around the world through regulated markets

concept.name: government aid
concept.definition: Supply of financial and other help by one government, usually to another

concept.name: government debt
concept.definition: The amount a government owes on bonds, services and for goods and services for which it has no ready cash

concept.name: interest rate
concept.definition: The amount of money one must pay to borrow money

concept.name: international economic institution
concept.definition: Entities such as UNIDO, World Bank, World Trade Organization, the Import-Expert Bank etc that deals at a world level

concept.name: international (foreign) trade
concept.definition: Trade of goods and services between nations

concept.name: loan market
concept.definition: The market where money is available to borrow, at certain rates of interest

concept.name: economic organization
concept.definition: Business, industrial and trade associations, societies and other private-sector groups.

concept.name: consumer confidence
concept.definition: Reports on consumer confidence in the economy.

concept.name: trade dispute
concept.definition: International dispute over trade barriers, cartels, dumping etc.

concept.name: inflation and deflation
concept.definition: An increase in the amount of money in circulation and thereby a rise in prices; deflation, tighter monetary policy causing lower prices

concept.name: prices
concept.definition: The monetary value of goods, services or stocks and bonds

concept.name: currency values
concept.definition: The value of one currency as measured against another

concept.name: budgets and budgeting
concept.definition: A method of balancing revenues against expenses

concept.name: credit and debt
concept.definition: Credit: the amount of money available to you, often by loan. Debt, the amount you owe.

concept.name: loans
concept.definition: An agreement by one individual or institution to temporarily disperse money to another, with an agreed rate and time for its return

concept.name: mortgages
concept.definition: The loan of money for the purpose of purchasing a property, whether land or building. Or, for homeowners to repair or maintain properties, often based on owner equity in a property

concept.name: financial markets
concept.definition: Institutions set up to trade the shares or other financial paper of companies or other organizations, can also include currency trading

concept.name: commodity markets
concept.definition: The bartering or trading of goods such as cotton, oil, coal, metals, etc

concept.name: investments
concept.definition: Speculative purchases of corporate instruments, of commodities, currencies, or parts thereof

concept.name: stocks
concept.definition: Corporate paper that gives an individual an ownership right to a part of a company's earnings

concept.name: bonds
concept.definition: Corporate or governmental paper representing the loan of money at a fixed rate and for a fixed time to that company or government

concept.name: mutual funds
concept.definition: Pools of shares or bonds for sale often grouped by investment intention, such as growth, income or security

concept.name: derivative securities
concept.definition: Financial instruments such as futures, swaps and options, used for risk management, whose characteristics and value depend upon the characteristics and value of an underlying instrument, such as a commodity, bond, equity or currency.

concept.name: imports
concept.definition: What is bought abroad and brought into a country for resale

concept.name: exports
concept.definition: What is produced or manufactured in your country and sent and sold elsewhere

concept.name: trade agreements
concept.definition: Government level agreements between countries for the sale and purchase of goods and services

concept.name: trade policy
concept.definition: Governmental decisions on tariffs, shipping, embargoes, and the types or kinds of goods and services to be imported and exported

concept.name: business enterprises
concept.definition: Organizations set up usually for profit-making purposes by creating and selling a product or service

concept.name: tariff
concept.definition: Fees placed on goods imported or exported, often punitive

concept.name: trade balance
concept.definition: The difference between the financial value of imports and exports

concept.name: market and exchange
concept.definition: Organized entities for buying and selling stocks, currencies, commodities and other goods

concept.name: energy
concept.definition: Stories related to energy trading and markets

concept.name: metal
concept.definition: Markets for trading base metals such as copper, aluminium, steel, zinc etc

concept.name: securities
concept.definition: Markets for trading types of company paper such as stocks and bonds

concept.name: soft commodity
concept.definition: Trading in commodities such as cotton, sugar, sorghum, soybeans etc.

concept.name: media
concept.definition: The various means of disseminating news and information to the public

concept.name: advertising
concept.definition: Methods of promoting goods and service to consumers through video, graphics, print text etc

concept.name: book
concept.definition: The business of producing and selling bound media, whether fiction or non-fiction

concept.name: cinema industry
concept.definition: Stories related to the business of cinema

concept.name: news agency
concept.definition: Commercial agencies for production and distribution of newsworthy events through print, broadcast, video or electronic media

concept.name: newspaper and magazine
concept.definition: The business of producing bound and unbound printed paper products for periodic distribution of news items

concept.name: online
concept.definition: The business of distributing news and information through computer networks for public consumption

concept.name: public relation
concept.definition: The job of promoting products and services through advertising campaigns and/or through person-to-person contact or through news releases

concept.name: radio industry
concept.definition: Stories related to the business of radio

concept.name: satellite and cable service
concept.definition: The business of transmitting of news, entertainment and information via satellite or cable television services

concept.name: television industry
concept.definition: Stories related to the business of television

concept.name: music industry
concept.definition: Recording, production, marketing of music

concept.name: manufacturing and engineering
concept.definition: Manufacturers of electrical, electronic and mechanical equipment but does not cover civil engineering.
concept.note: Name changed, Explanation added in V 15

concept.name: aerospace
concept.definition: Companies that assemble or manufacture components for airplanes and space ships.

concept.name: automotive equipment
concept.definition: Companies that produce components for automobiles

concept.name: defence equipment
concept.definition: Manufacturers of guns, tanks, cannons, ships etc for the military and non-military protection services

concept.name: electrical appliance
concept.definition: Makers of large and small electrical goods for use in homes or business

concept.name: heavy engineering
concept.definition: Manufacturers of cranes, bulldozers and the like for use in major construction projects

concept.name: industrial component
concept.definition: Manufacturers of mechanical, electrical, electronic items needed in the manufacture of other items

concept.name: instrument engineering
concept.definition: Manufacturers of instruments for calibration, measurement of things like speed, pressure, distance

concept.name: shipbuilding
concept.definition: Manufacturers of ships, submarines, barges.

concept.name: machine manufacturing
concept.definition: Manufacturers of turbines, engines, fans , pumps , motors and components for powered equipment.

concept.name: metal and mineral
concept.definition: Production and refining of ores into metals

concept.name: building material
concept.definition: Manufacture of materials like wallboard, lumber wiring for the building industry

concept.name: gold and precious material
concept.definition: Mining, refining and sales of gold and other precious metals

concept.name: iron and steel
concept.definition: Mining, refining and sales of iron-based metals

concept.name: non ferrous metal
concept.definition: Mining, refining and sales of copper, zinc, aluminium, and other metals not based on iron

concept.name: mining
concept.definition: The industry of digging for metals, raw materials such as coal, or precious gems such as diamonds

concept.name: process industry
concept.definition: The business of turning raw materials into useable products

concept.name: distiller and brewer
concept.definition: Manufacture of alcoholic beverages

concept.name: food
concept.definition: The business of processing, distributing and selling for basic human consumption

concept.name: furnishings and furniture
concept.definition: Manufacture of furniture, wallpaper, paints and fabrics for interior decoration

concept.name: paper and packaging product
concept.definition: Production of paper material for writing, wrapping, printing, or packaging

concept.name: rubber product
concept.definition: Production of rubber based materials for gloves, protective coatings, hoses and the like

concept.name: soft drinks
concept.definition: Production of non-alcoholic drinks

concept.name: textile and clothing
concept.definition: Production of fabrics for furnishings and fixtures, and for clothing of various types

concept.name: tobacco
concept.definition: Growing, producing and sale of tobacco products

concept.name: tourism and leisure
concept.definition: Stories about the tourism and leisure industries

concept.name: casino and gambling
concept.definition: The business of providing outlets for various games of chance using cards, dice, spinning wheels to betting on animal races

concept.name: hotel and accommodation
concept.definition: The business of providing food and shelter to travellers

concept.name: recreational and sporting goods
concept.definition: Manufacture of goods for leisure activities

concept.name: restaurant and catering
concept.definition: The business of providing prepared foods for customers in groups large and small

concept.name: tour operator
concept.definition: Operators of trips either locally, as around town, or to other countries

concept.name: transport
concept.definition: The means of getting from one place to the other without walking

concept.name: air transport
concept.definition: Airplane and airport operations

concept.name: railway
concept.definition: The business of transporting people or cargo by rail

concept.name: road transport
concept.definition: The business of transport goods by trucks and highways

concept.name: waterway and maritime transport
concept.definition: Commercial movement of people or goods via boats, ships and water

concept.name: company information
concept.definition: Information about individual companies or business entities

concept.name: accounting and audit
concept.definition: Changes in choice of auditing firm. Reports on impact of changes in GAAP.

concept.name: annual and special corporate meeting
concept.definition: Announcements of upcoming meetings. Reports on meetings.

concept.name: annual report
concept.definition: Stories regarding availability or contents of annual company reports.

concept.name: antitrust issue
concept.definition: Stories regarding antitrust activities, monopoly regulation, etc.

concept.name: merger, acquisition and takeover
concept.definition: News on mergers, takeovers or acquisitions.

concept.name: analysts' comment
concept.definition: Stories containing stock analyst comments, analysis and recommendations.

concept.name: bankruptcy
concept.definition: News about actual bankruptcy filings.

concept.name: board of directors (appointment and change)
concept.definition: News regarding appointments to or changes in the board of directors for a company.

concept.name: buyback
concept.definition: News regarding stock buyback programs. This should be kept distinct from Stock Activity (see below).

concept.name: C.E.O. interview
concept.definition: Interviews with Chief Executive Officers.

concept.name: corporate officer
concept.definition: Appointments or changes in corporate officers.

concept.name: corporate profile
concept.definition: Stories that contain descriptive profiles of companies.

concept.name: contract
concept.definition: News about commercial contracts.

concept.name: defence contract
concept.definition: The award of government contracts for defence related activity.

concept.name: dividend announcement
concept.definition: Announcements regarding the disbursement of dividends.

concept.name: earnings forecast
concept.definition: Analyst prediction of company earnings.

concept.name: financially distressed company
concept.definition: News that a company is financially distressed - not yet having filed for bankruptcy.

concept.name: earnings
concept.definition: Any release of earnings results.

concept.name: financing and stock offering
concept.definition: Stories regarding new offerings of equity including initial public offerings.

concept.name: government contract
concept.definition: The award of government contracts not related to defence activity

concept.name: global expansion
concept.definition: Planned or actual openings of offices in countries for the first time.

concept.name: insider trading
concept.definition: Reports on the purchase or sales of stock by corporate officers or board members.

concept.name: joint venture
concept.definition: News regarding joint ventures between companies. (Not marketing related - see Marketing.)

concept.name: leveraged buyout
concept.definition: News about leveraged buyouts.

concept.name: layoffs and downsizing
concept.definition: Planned or actual reductions in the labour force.

concept.name: licensing agreement
concept.definition: Stories about licensing agreements between companies.

concept.name: litigation and regulation
concept.definition: Stories regarding corporate law including litigation and regulations.

concept.name: management change
concept.definition: Major appointments or changes in management below the level of corporate officer.

concept.name: marketing
concept.definition: Includes news regarding joint marketing agreements between companies, adoption of new product marketing strategies, etc.

concept.name: new product
concept.definition: Announcements of new products.

concept.name: patent, copyright and trademark
concept.definition: News related to patents, copyright and trademarks.

concept.name: plant closing
concept.definition: Announcements of planned or actual plant closings.

concept.name: plant opening
concept.definition: Announcements of planned or actual plant openings.

concept.name: privatisation
concept.definition: Stories regarding the privatisation (privatisation) of state run companies.

concept.name: proxy filing
concept.definition: Filings with regulatory agencies of proxy statements for upcoming shareholder votes.

concept.name: rating
concept.definition: Corporate and sovereign debt and credit ratings (e.g. SandP or Moody's)

concept.name: research and development
concept.definition: News about research and expenditure on new product development.

concept.name: quarterly or semiannual financial statement
concept.definition: Stories regarding the availability or contents of quarterly or semi-annual corporate reports.

concept.name: restructuring and recapitalisation
concept.definition: Stories involving the sale of company units, splits of existing companies into units under a holding company, etc.

concept.name: spin-off
concept.definition: Stories regarding the creation of new companies being spun off from existing companies.

concept.name: stock activity
concept.definition: Announcements of major stock events: splits, block trades, new highs or lows, etc.

concept.name: industrial production
concept.definition: Manufacture of durable and non-durable goods

concept.name: productivity
concept.definition: The cost of labour to produce an item of value, often measured as output per hour per person

concept.name: inventories
concept.definition: Goods not sold and held by the producer, wholesaler or retailer

concept.name: sales
concept.definition: Either the exchange of goods for money, or the practice of discounting prices to increase the amount of goods sold, or to get rid of outdated merchandise

concept.name: corporations
concept.definition: Business enterprises formally licensed with boards of directors and hierarchical structures of governance

concept.name: shareholders
concept.definition: Anyone holding a piece of paper issued by a company which changes in value and entitles them to dividends depending on the performance of the company

concept.name: corporate performance
concept.definition: How well a company performs, measured by its net earnings, its dividends its earnings per share and price/earnings ratio

concept.name: losses
concept.definition: When expenses exceed revenue

concept.name: credit ratings
concept.definition: Formal statements by certain rating agencies such as Standard and Poor's on the investment risk of a company, a country or enterprise

concept.name: stock splits
concept.definition: Issuing multiple shares for one share of stock. Usually occurs when the price of a stock has increased so much that its purchase price is not attractive. A reverse split is when one share is issued for multiple shares, to raise the per share value.

concept.name: stock options
concept.definition: An agreement to either buy or sell a stock when it meets a certain price

concept.name: recalls (products)
concept.definition: A decision by a company to take back or repair a defective product

concept.name: globalization
concept.definition: Doing business around the world

concept.name: consumers
concept.definition: Buyers of goods and services

concept.name: purchase
concept.definition: Items that companies buy, such as raw materials, office supplies etc.

concept.name: new service
concept.definition: New services added by a company, such as new flight routes, etc.

concept.name: economy (general)
concept.definition: Content of a general nature about trade and the economy

concept.name: economic policy
concept.definition: Government directed policy on production, taxes, tariffs and things that affect the direction and health of the economy

concept.name: business (general)
concept.definition: Content of a general nature about business

concept.name: institution
concept.definition: Either an established law, practice or system or an organization having a social, religious, educational or similar purpose such as hospital, school, prison

concept.name: finance (general)
concept.definition: Content of a general nature about finance

concept.name: money and monetary policy
concept.definition: Government bank directed policy on the amount of money in circulation and the rate at which it can be loaned

concept.name: education
concept.definition: All aspects of furthering knowledge of human individuals from birth to death.

concept.name: adult education
concept.definition: Education provided for older students outside the usual age groups of 5-25

concept.name: further education
concept.definition: Any form of education beyond basic education of several levels

concept.name: parent organisation
concept.definition: Groups of parents set up to support schools

concept.name: preschool
concept.definition: Education for children under the national compulsory education age

concept.name: school
concept.definition: A building or institution in which education of various sorts is provided

concept.name: elementary schools
concept.definition: Schools usually of a level from kindergarten through 11 or 12 years of age

concept.name: middle schools
concept.definition: Transitional school between elementary and high school, 12 through 13 years of age

concept.name: high schools
concept.definition: Pre-college/ university level education, 14 to 17 or 18 years of age, called freshman, sophomore, junior and senior

concept.name: teachers union
concept.definition: Organization of teachers for collective bargaining and other purposes

concept.name: university
concept.definition: Institutions of higher learning capable of providing doctorate degrees

concept.name: upbringing
concept.definition: Lessons learned from parents and others as one grows up

concept.name: entrance examination
concept.definition: Exams for entering colleges, universities, junior and senior high schools, and all other higher and lower education institutes, including cram schools, which help students prepare for exams for entry to prestigious schools.

concept.name: teaching and learning
concept.definition: Either end of the education equation

concept.name: students
concept.definition: People of any age in a structured environment, not necessarily a classroom, in order to learn something

concept.name: teachers
concept.definition: People with knowledge who can impart that knowledge to others

concept.name: curriculum
concept.definition: The courses offered by a learning institution and the regulation of those courses

concept.name: test/examination
concept.definition: A measurement of student accomplishment

concept.name: religious education
concept.definition: Instruction by any faith, in that faith or about other faiths, usually, but not always, conducted in schools run by religious bodies

concept.name: parochial school
concept.definition: A school run by the Roman Catholic faith

concept.name: seminary
concept.definition: A school of any faith specifically designed to train ministers

concept.name: yeshiva
concept.definition: A school for training rabbis

concept.name: madrasa
concept.definition: A school for teaching Islam

concept.name: environmental issue
concept.definition: All aspects of protection, damage, and condition of the ecosystem of the planet earth and its surroundings.

concept.name: renewable energy
concept.definition: Stories about the environmental impact of renewable energy, including solar, wind, hydro, biomass and geothermal

concept.name: conservation
concept.definition: Stories about preservation of wilderness areas, flora and fauna, including species extinction

concept.name: endangered species
concept.definition: Those species of wildlife in danger of disappearing, largely because of changes in environment, hunting, or weather

concept.name: ecosystem
concept.definition: A system of plants, animals and bacteria interrelated in its physical/chemical environment

concept.name: energy saving
concept.definition: Conservation of electrical, and other power sources

concept.name: environmental politics
concept.definition: The debate on environmental policy

concept.name: environmental pollution
concept.definition: Corruption of air, water, land etc. by harmful substances

concept.name: air pollution
concept.definition: Solid or gaseous matter affecting the quality of air that we breathe

concept.name: water pollution
concept.definition: Solids or liquids that corrupt the quality of water that could be used for drinking or irrigation

concept.name: natural resources
concept.definition: Stories about the environmental issues related to the exploitation of natural resources for human use

concept.name: land resources
concept.definition: That portion of a nation or state that is above water and available for development either for profit or for the general good of the public

concept.name: parks
concept.definition: Areas set aside and developed for public enjoyment and recreation, including commercial development such as theme parks

concept.name: forests
concept.definition: Open areas of trees either available for public enjoyment, or for commercial purposes

concept.name: wetlands
concept.definition: Areas generally marshy and not either under water or dry land. Often related to aquifers for water quality and/or wildlife

concept.name: mountains
concept.definition: Elevated land masses formed over the ages either by erosion, volcanic eruption, or movement of massive geographical formations called plates

concept.name: rivers
concept.definition: Moving water areas bounded by land that extend from earth sources and meander through land areas to join with other water areas. In smaller forms they are creeks, rivulets, streams etc

concept.name: oceans
concept.definition: Salt water masses separating continents or other major geographical masses. smaller forms are seas or lakes or ponds

concept.name: wildlife
concept.definition: All forms of animal life that have not been domesticated

concept.name: energy resources
concept.definition: Such resources as coal, gas, wind, sunlight etc., used to generate heat, electricity and power

concept.name: nature
concept.definition: Taken as a whole the natural environment of flora and fauna

concept.name: invasive species
concept.definition: Non-native plants, animals and other organisms that tend to take over native species

concept.name: population
concept.definition: People and their growth and development within a natural setting

concept.name: waste
concept.definition: Stories about the environmental impact of waste, including recycling efforts

concept.name: water
concept.definition: Stories concerning environmental issues about bodies of water, including oceans, lakes, streams and reservoirs, as well as ice, glaciers and forms of precipitation

concept.name: global warming
concept.definition: This category includes all issues relating to global warming including temperature research, remote sensing on temperature trends, debate on global warming, ways to reduce emissions and carbon trading.

concept.name: hazardous materials
concept.definition: Materials that are harmful to humans or animals if they are exposed to them. Includes radiation, poison gases, chemicals, heavy metals, PCBs, and certain plant products

concept.name: environmental cleanup
concept.definition: Processes whereby contaminated areas are cleaned of hazardous materials so they can be inhabited again by either people or animals.

concept.name: health
concept.definition: All aspects pertaining to the physical and mental welfare of human beings.

concept.name: disease
concept.definition: Any harmful or destructive condition

concept.name: communicable diseases
concept.definition: Diseases that can be transmitted from one person or animal to another

concept.name: virus diseases
concept.definition: Diseases caused by infection within cells by viruses

concept.name: AIDS
concept.definition: Acquired Immunity Deficiency Syndrome, an incurable disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus

concept.name: cancer
concept.definition: A serious and often fatal disease caused when normal cells mutate into tumours

concept.name: heart disease
concept.definition: A degenerative and serious disease caused by narrowing of the arteries feeding the heart

concept.name: alzheimer's disease
concept.definition: A disorder of the brain leading to dementia

concept.name: animal diseases
concept.definition: Disorders affecting animals that do not necessarily endanger humans

concept.name: plant diseases
concept.definition: Disorders affecting plants caused either by parasites or environmental factors

concept.name: retrovirus
concept.definition: A family of RNA viruses such as those causing leukaemia and AIDS

concept.name: epidemic and plague
concept.definition: An epidemic is a rapidly spreading condition in a community and a plague is usually a deadly disease of epidemic proportions

concept.name: health treatment
concept.definition: In general treatment of diseases and other conditions to produce wellness

concept.name: prescription drugs
concept.definition: Drugs that can be purchased only with a doctor's authorization

concept.name: dietary supplements
concept.definition: Nutrients taken in addition to food to bolster health

concept.name: diet
concept.definition: Controlled food consumption

concept.name: medical procedure/test
concept.definition: Any of a variety of treatments such as stress tests, catheterization, blood tests, computerised axial tomography scan or magnetic resonance imaging

concept.name: therapy
concept.definition: Treatment of physical, mental or medical conditions by non-surgical means

concept.name: health organisations
concept.definition: Includes stories about specific health organizations, including professional associations, non-profits and international groups

concept.name: medical research
concept.definition: Investigation into the causes and cures of diseases

concept.name: medical staff
concept.definition: Doctors, nurses, interns and others in a medical facility

concept.name: medicine
concept.definition: A substance used with the expectation that it will eliminate disease or illness

concept.name: herbal
concept.definition: Treatment based on the use of herbs and other plants to cure or alleviate disease symptoms

concept.name: holistic
concept.definition: Treatment of the whole person including mental and social factors rather than just the symptoms of the disease.

concept.name: western
concept.definition: The practice of diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease based on modern scientific research in the western hemisphere.

concept.name: traditional Chinese
concept.definition: The practice of diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease based on traditional methods developed in the orient.

concept.name: preventative medicine
concept.definition: Substances used to prevent diseases or illnesses

concept.name: vaccines
concept.definition: Medications designed to create immunity to diseases

concept.name: injury
concept.definition: A traumatic condition of the human body caused usually by outside forces

concept.name: hospital and clinic
concept.definition: Medical facilities for the treatment of illnesses and injury

concept.name: government health care
concept.definition: Health care provided by national governments

concept.name: medicare
concept.definition: A program of the U.S. government to provide health care to senior citizens

concept.name: medicaid
concept.definition: A program of the U.S. government to provide health care to needy citizens of all ages

concept.name: private health care
concept.definition: Health care provided by privately funded or insured organizations

concept.name: healthcare policy
concept.definition: Health-related policy decisions including what different countries are doing regarding prescription drug policies, AIDS, psychiatric care, health care funding and related topics.

concept.name: food safety
concept.definition: Issues relating to food cleanliness and contamination

concept.name: medical specialisation
concept.definition: The different medical specialist areas.

concept.name: geriatric
concept.definition: Research into aging and age-related issues including age-related illnesses, medical research, trends, geriatric medicine and related topics like age discrimination and health insurance for an ageing population.

concept.name: pediatrics
concept.definition: Research and medicine specifically for the young - includes premature babies, infant care, childhood disease and treatment - also teen-related health and behaviour problems.

concept.name: reproduction
concept.definition: This would include reproductive technologies like invitro fertilization and cloning as well as related debates. Sexual development matters and sexually transmitted diseases would also fall under this category.

concept.name: genetics
concept.definition: The science and research into genetic-base disease and cures for disease. This would include proteomics (the study of what proteins are produced by which genes and what those proteins do), general genetics and stem-cell research.

concept.name: obstetrics/gynecology
concept.definition: Specialty of female reproductive organs

concept.name: medical service
concept.definition: medical support for doctors, including blood tests and other medical tests on individuals, X-rays CAT scans MRIs etc.

concept.name: physical fitness
concept.definition: The condition of a person's cardio-vascular and muscular health.

concept.name: illness
concept.definition: Non-specific maladies such as stomach aches, headaches, flat feet, lumbago

concept.name: mental illness
concept.definition: Those illnesses affecting the mind

concept.name: eating disorder
concept.definition: Anorexia, bulimia, overeating and similar illnesses

concept.name: obesity
concept.definition: A condition of body weight generally considered 20 percent above the norm for gender, age, height and bone structure

concept.name: medical conditions
concept.definition: Various stages of disease, illness or injury

concept.name: human interest
concept.definition: Lighter items about individuals, groups, animals or objects.

concept.name: animal
concept.definition: Stories involving animals of all types

concept.name: curiosity
concept.definition: Stories of an unusual nature that can raise questions or amuse

concept.name: people
concept.definition: Unusual stories about people of all levels

concept.name: advice
concept.definition: Letters and answers about personal problems that are publishable

concept.name: celebrity
concept.definition: News about celebrities, i.e. Madonna has a baby, Elton John sues his accountants etc.

concept.name: accomplishment
concept.definition: Achievements by individuals or groups, such as charitable fundraising, winning a competitive contest etc

concept.name: human mishap
concept.definition: Stories arising from silly/stupid human errors e.g. like forgetting to tie one end of a bungee cord

concept.name: mystery
concept.definition: Something unexplained or unknown

concept.name: society
concept.definition: Stories of well-known people

concept.name: ceremony
concept.definition: Rituals of a non-religious nature such as dedications, wreath layings, ship launchings etc

concept.name: award and prize
concept.definition: Decorations, awards and prizes, including those given by the government.

concept.name: record
concept.definition: Non-sport achievement by an individual or group that sets a new record, such as most books read, holding your breath longest

concept.name: imperial and royal matters
concept.definition: News on imperial and royal family members, including matters on legal systems.

concept.name: labour
concept.definition: Social aspects, organizations, rules and conditions affecting the employment of human effort for the generation of wealth or provision of services and the economic support of the unemployed.

concept.name: apprentices
concept.definition: People who are in the work force at a learning level, serving under a master

concept.name: collective contract
concept.definition: Usually written contracts covering a specific class of worker

concept.name: contract issue-wages
concept.definition: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on remuneration

concept.name: contract issue-healthcare
concept.definition: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on health care issues

concept.name: contract issue-work rules
concept.definition: Element of contracts and contract discussions centring on rules affecting issues such as lunch and other breaks, work shifts, vacation scheduling, seniority, sick leave etc.

concept.name: employment
concept.definition: Paid labour

concept.name: labor market
concept.definition: A pool of people who are working or are seeking work

concept.name: job layoffs
concept.definition: The reduction of a company's work force through dismissal because of changing economic factors

concept.name: child labor
concept.definition: Employment of children, usually under the age of 18

concept.name: occupations
concept.definition: Generally one's trade, profession or business although professions are usually such things as lawyers and doctors, and occupations are such as clerks or truckers

concept.name: labour dispute
concept.definition: Differences of opinion about work conditions, pay, etc

concept.name: labour legislation
concept.definition: Laws governing work and labour

concept.name: retirement
concept.definition: The years after work

concept.name: retraining
concept.definition: Providing a worker training in new skills when his old skills are no longer applicable

concept.name: strike
concept.definition: A job action involving cessation of work

concept.name: unemployment
concept.definition: Lack of paid work

concept.name: unions
concept.definition: Groups established to represent bodies of workers

concept.name: wage and pension
concept.definition: Parts of a salary divided for current income and future income

concept.name: employee benefits
concept.definition: Either benefits provided to an employee by a company, such as pensions, health insurance; or monetary compensation paid by a government to the jobless usually called unemployment benefits

concept.name: social security
concept.definition: FICA. Money paid by individual and companies into a government account to be paid out when that individual reaches a certain age

concept.name: work relations
concept.definition: The give and take between management and labour

concept.name: health and safety at work
concept.definition: Rules and procedures for guaranteeing the health of workers

concept.name: advanced training
concept.definition: Additional training to enhance current skills

concept.name: employer
concept.definition: The person who employs workers and pays the salaries and other benefits to workers

concept.name: employee
concept.definition: A person who trades his time and talent for money and other benefits

concept.name: lifestyle and leisure
concept.definition: Activities undertaken for pleasure, relaxation or recreation outside paid employment, including eating and travel.

concept.name: game
concept.definition: Contests generally for ones amusement

concept.name: Go
concept.definition: A strategic, deterministic Chinese board game played by alternately placing stones on a grid

concept.name: chess
concept.definition: A game played on a chequered board with 16 pieces to each side with specific ranges of movement depending on their identity

concept.name: bridge
concept.definition: A card game of four players who bet on the hands of each other, developed from Russian whist

concept.name: gaming and lottery
concept.definition: Gambling, often involving selection of sets of numbers one expects to come up

concept.name: gastronomy
concept.definition: The art of good eating

concept.name: organic foods
concept.definition: Food which is grown using no artificial fertilizers or chemical compounds

concept.name: hobby
concept.definition: Various types of activities for amusement, such as collecting stamps, building models, quilting, crafts

concept.name: holiday or vacation
concept.definition: Stories about leisure travel to a single location and/or country over a short period of time

concept.name: tourism
concept.definition: Stories about leisure travel involving visits to a number of locations and/or countries over an extended period of time, often as part of an organized group

concept.name: travel and commuting
concept.definition: Stories about transport options, travel networks, commuting, car pooling and business travel

concept.name: traffic
concept.definition: Traffic reports and/or warnings

concept.name: club and association
concept.definition: Organizations joined by individuals because of similar interests

concept.name: lifestyle (house and home)
concept.definition: Unique culture of ones own home

concept.name: leisure (general)
concept.definition: Activities carried out in ones' spare time

concept.name: public holiday
concept.definition: A day or days set off for celebration

concept.name: hunting
concept.definition: An activity involving the use of weapons or traps for the capturing of animals

concept.name: fishing
concept.definition: An activity involving the use of baits, lures, weapons and traps for the capture of aquatic species

concept.name: auto trends
concept.definition: The evolution of the automobile

concept.name: politics
concept.definition: Local, regional, national and international exercise of power, or struggle for power, and the relationships between governing bodies and states.

concept.name: defence
concept.definition: Anything involving the defence of one's own country

concept.name: veterans affairs
concept.definition: Care and provision for those who served in the military

concept.name: national security
concept.definition: The philosophy of securing a nation and its borders, as well as the well being of its citizens

concept.name: security measures
concept.definition: Means of making a nation, a state, a building or a person secure from harm and outside interference.

concept.name: armed Forces
concept.definition: Those employed by a government to conduct war, or to enforce the security of a nation

concept.name: military equipment
concept.definition: Equipment issued to members of the armed forces

concept.name: firearms
concept.definition: Anything that uses an explosive in a directed manner to propel an object that can maim or kill

concept.name: biological and chemical weapons
concept.definition: Devices using biological agents, or chemical mixtures to disable, maim or kill an opponent

concept.name: missile systems
concept.definition: Anything that propels an inert, explosive, biological or chemical object through the air with the aim of disabling, maiming or killing an opponent.

concept.name: nuclear weapons
concept.definition: Weapons that use controlled radioactivity from the decay of certain elements to disable, maim or kill an opponent

concept.name: diplomacy
concept.definition: The use of verbal and written skills for persuading others to your point of view

concept.name: summit
concept.definition: Includes meetings of leaders, foreign and finance ministers from the Group of Eight major nations and Group of Seven industrialized nations.

concept.name: international relations
concept.definition: Non-violent relations between nations through negotiation, treaty, or personal meetings

concept.name: election
concept.definition: The selection of representatives by the casting of votes

concept.name: political candidates
concept.definition: Individuals who are chosen to stand for office

concept.name: political campaigns
concept.definition: Campaigns for public office

concept.name: campaign finance
concept.definition: The money that makes campaigns for public office possible

concept.name: national elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for government at a national level

concept.name: regional elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for government at a regional level

concept.name: local elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for government at the basic level, whether city, village or county

concept.name: voting
concept.definition: The act of selecting an individual you would like to represent your interests in government

concept.name: poll
concept.definition: Periodic measurement of a political candidate's standing with the public

concept.name: european elections
concept.definition: Choosing individuals for a body which is at a higher level than national government, e.g. European parliament

concept.name: primary
concept.definition: Preliminary elections on a local or regional basis leading up to a regional or national election

concept.name: espionage and intelligence
concept.definition: Covert collection of information

concept.name: foreign aid
concept.definition: Help provided by one nation to another

concept.name: economic sanction
concept.definition: Punitive actions taken by one country against another including trade restrictions, embargoes etc.

concept.name: government
concept.definition: The system for ruling a country

concept.name: civil and public service
concept.definition: The paid service by civilians for the government, and the often non-paid service of individuals for the benefit of others (public service)

concept.name: safety of citizens
concept.definition: Government policies to protect the well being of its citizens

concept.name: think tank
concept.definition: Group that undertakes political research and issue position papers, recommendations etc

concept.name: national government
concept.definition: The ruling body of a nation

concept.name: executive (government)
concept.definition: That portion of a ruling body involving the overall operation of government

concept.name: heads of state
concept.definition: Symbolic or actual chief representative of a nation, such as royalty, or president or emir, for example

concept.name: government departments
concept.definition: Divisions of a government that concentrate on specific areas such as health, welfare, economy or war

concept.name: public officials
concept.definition: Individuals, usually elected, who are in public service or commonly in the public eye.

concept.name: ministers (government)
concept.definition: Heads of various government departments at one level, also known as secretaries. At another level they form a legislative body. The chief minister is either prime minister or premier.

concept.name: public employees
concept.definition: People employed by a government at all levels

concept.name: privatisation
concept.definition: The privatisation of state-owned companies or property

concept.name: nationalisation
concept.definition: State takeover of private companies or property

concept.name: impeachment
concept.definition: The process of bringing a public official before a tribunal to answer charges of wrongdoing

concept.name: human rights
concept.definition: Rights entitled to be enjoyed by all citizens universally

concept.name: local authority
concept.definition: Authorities at city, county state or borough level

concept.name: parliament
concept.definition: The collective body of elected officials representing the people

concept.name: upper house
concept.definition: Senior chamber of a legislative body

concept.name: lower house
concept.definition: The lower chamber of a legislative body

concept.name: parties and movements
concept.definition: Covers both formally recognized and informal political associations

concept.name: non government organizations (NGO)
concept.definition: Groups officially outside of government that lobby, demonstrate or campaign on a wide range of issues such as economics, environment healthcare etc.

concept.name: refugee
concept.definition: A person seeking shelter in another country because of some fear of persecution in his own country

concept.name: regional authority
concept.definition: Government bodies at levels encompassing more than one jurisdiction, e.g. the Delaware River Basin Commission

concept.name: state budget and tax
concept.definition: The national budget as promulgated by the government

concept.name: public finance
concept.definition: The money of government used for paying for public programs and services and public debt

concept.name: treaty and international organisation-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Formal bodies to regulate activities between nation states, often on the basis of written agreements
concept.note: DEPRECATED in V 16, split to SubjectMatters 11027 and 11028

concept.name: international relations-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Non-violent relations between nations through negotiation, treaty, or personal meetings

concept.name: peace negotiations-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Negotiations intended to bring an end to a conflict

concept.name: alliances-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Coalitions of like-minded groups formed to present a stronger force against any challenges

concept.name: constitution
concept.definition: Usually a written document setting forth the operations of a government and the rights of the citizens therein

concept.name: interior policy
concept.definition: Government policies affecting internal affairs of a country

concept.name: data protection
concept.definition: Efforts to protect personal information in either written, oral or electronic form

concept.name: housing and urban planning
concept.definition: Systematic planning of urban and suburban areas and the housing within those areas

concept.name: pension and welfare
concept.definition: Government policies affecting the well being of its citizens through unemployment benefits, state pensions and other similar payments

concept.name: personal weapon control
concept.definition: Government control of personal ownership of firearms and other offensive weapons, including control of weapons used for sports through licenses and other means

concept.name: indigenous people
concept.definition: Government policies toward indigenous peoples

concept.name: personal data collection
concept.definition: The collection, by government or other entities of information on individuals

concept.name: planning inquiries
concept.definition: Public hearings or planning inquiries on proposed constructions, e.g. Construction of water driven power station in a National Park.

concept.name: migration
concept.definition: Movement of one body of persons from one place to another

concept.name: citizens initiative and recall
concept.definition: Political suggestions by non-government officials for corrective action, or for changes in existing rules and regulations

concept.name: referenda
concept.definition: Political proposals, laws and actions suggested by non-government officials to be voted on by the entire voting body

concept.name: nuclear policy
concept.definition: Government policies as regards to use of nuclear fuels for power production or weapons

concept.name: lobbying
concept.definition: The attempt by non-government bodies and individual to affect the outcome of legislation through verbal, or other, persuasion

concept.name: regulatory policy and organisation
concept.definition: The rules and bodies, both national and international, that govern conflict of interest and good practice regulations.

concept.name: censorship
concept.definition: Attempts by any group to control freedoms of speech, religion, and ideas distributed in print, graphics, cyberspace and other ways. Does not include official standards such as cinema ratings, advertising and broadcast standards.
concept.note: replaced by "freedom of press" in V 12, reintroduced in V13

concept.name: politics (general)
concept.definition: The art or science of participating in the affairs of government, a state of political party

concept.name: political systems
concept.definition: Systems designed to provide order to government

concept.name: democracy
concept.definition: Government in which the people hold the power either directly, or through elected officials.

concept.name: political development
concept.definition: The creation and rise of political systems and the history of the people and nations that are associated with those systems.

concept.name: freedom of the press
concept.definition: Stories about mass media rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the journalists, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organizations and other NGOs in regards to press freedom
concept.note: replaced "censorship" in V12, added as new Topic in V13

concept.name: freedom of religion
concept.definition: Stories about religious rights and freedoms, pressure and intimidation of the believers, censorship in mass media, activities of government bodies, journalistic associations and/or organizations and other NGOs in regards to freedom of belief and practice

concept.name: treaty
concept.definition: A treaty (as defined by the Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties) is a written agreement between international entities that is binding under international law.

concept.name: international organisation
concept.definition: Includes organisations with members and functions that cross international borders, and may include intergovernmental organisations of sovereign nations.

concept.name: religion and belief
concept.definition: All aspects of human existence involving theology, philosophy, ethics and spirituality.

concept.name: cult and sect
concept.definition: Offshoots of established religious bodies, or small narrow-focused group promulgated by one or two individuals

concept.name: belief (faith)
concept.definition: The established beliefs of an individuals religion

concept.name: unificationism
concept.definition: The belief system of members of the Unification Church established by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon.

concept.name: scientology
concept.definition: Believe that man is a spiritual being endowed with abilities well beyond those which he normally envisages; he's able to solve his own problems, accomplish his goals and gain lasting happiness.

concept.name: freemasonry
concept.definition: A secret international society based on the principles of brotherhood, charity and mutual aid

concept.name: religion-DEPRECATED
