concept.definition: Established theologies with fixed systems of belief
concept.note: SubjectMatter deprecated, SubjectDetails moved to other SubjectMatter

concept.name: christianity-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Those that use Jesus Christ and his teachings as their centre of belief

concept.name: islam-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Those who use Allah and his teachings as their centre of belief

concept.name: judaism-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: A group believing in one god, basing their beliefs on written scriptures and the Talmud, including the first coming of the Messiah

concept.name: buddhism-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: A major Asian religion founded by Buddha in the 6th century in India and preaching that right thinking and self denial will lead to a divine state without desire

concept.name: hinduism-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: A religious and social system, believing in a caste system with the Brahmans the highest and untouchables the lowest.

concept.name: church (organisation)-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Generally an edifice identifiable as a place of worship for the Christian religion

concept.name: religious facilities-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: Any facility where a group can carry out its religious rites whether it is a mosque, a church, a house or a tent

concept.name: values
concept.definition: Personal levels of social behaviour

concept.name: ethics
concept.definition: A system of beliefs about acceptable behaviour

concept.name: corrupt practices
concept.definition: Any action which is harmful to others

concept.name: church and state relations
concept.definition: The legal and social division between religious institutions and the affairs of state

concept.name: philosophy
concept.definition: Different thoughts about the way the world works

concept.name: christianity
concept.definition: Those that use Jesus Christ and his teachings as their centre of belief

concept.name: protestant
concept.definition: General term for christian churches and religious communities which developed through the reformation in the 16th century

concept.name: lutheran
concept.definition: Christians who follow the teaching of reformer Martin Luther

concept.name: reformed
concept.definition: Christians who follow the teaching of reformers Johannes Calvin and Ulrich Zwingli

concept.name: anglican
concept.definition: Members of the worldwide anglican communion which started in the 16th century in England as a breakaway church from the roman catholic church

concept.name: methodist
concept.definition: Followers of John and Charles Wesley who tried to reform the Church of England in the 18th century and turned into a separate church

concept.name: baptist
concept.definition: Members of a christian church which only baptises adults who truly believe in Christ

concept.name: mennonite
concept.definition: Members of a 16th century christian church which is against military service and baptising infants

concept.name: mormon
concept.definition: Members of a religious community which believes in the "Book of Mormon" and the revelations of founder M.J. Smith

concept.name: roman catholic
concept.definition: Biggest christian church worldwide tracing its origins back to Jesus Christ

concept.name: old catholic
concept.definition: Members of a catholic church which started in 1870 and denies the dogma of the infallibility of the pope

concept.name: orthodoxy
concept.definition: Eastern rite churches which are characterised by their continuity with the apostolic church, their liturgy and their territorial churches, mainly in eastern and south-eastern Europe and the Middle East

concept.name: salvation army
concept.definition: Christian community organised in a military fashion which does missionary and social work

concept.name: islam
concept.definition: Those who use Allah and his teachings as their centre of belief

concept.name: judaism
concept.definition: A group believing in one god, basing their beliefs on written scriptures and the Talmud, including the first coming of the Messiah

concept.name: buddhism
concept.definition: A major Asian religion founded by Buddha in the 6th century BC in India and preaching that right thinking and self denial will lead to a divine state without desire

concept.name: hinduism
concept.definition: A religious and social system, believing in a caste system with the Brahmans the highest and untouchables the lowest.

concept.name: religious festival or holiday
concept.definition: Holy day or day of observance in a religion which sometimes is a public holiday as well

concept.name: christmas
concept.definition: Christian festival in commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ

concept.name: easter
concept.definition: Christian festival in commemorating the resurrection of Jesus Christ

concept.name: pentecost
concept.definition: Christian festival, celebrated on the 50th day after Easter commemorating the descent of the Holy Spirit

concept.name: ramadan
concept.definition: Holy month of fasting in Islam

concept.name: yom kippur
concept.definition: Most solemn of Jewish religious holidays, observed on the 10th day of the lunar month of tishri (in the course of September and October, when Jews seek reconciliation with god

concept.name: religious leader
concept.definition: Person or persons who have a ritual, juridical or otherwise leading role in their respective church or religion

concept.name: pope
concept.definition: Head of the roman catholic church worldwide

concept.name: nature religion
concept.definition: Worship of natural elements like fire, water, trees, mountains

concept.name: taoism
concept.definition: Indigenous religio-philosophical tradition that has shaped Chinese life for more than 2000 years

concept.name: shintoism
concept.definition: Indigenous religious beliefs and practices of Japan. The word Shinto came into use in order to distinguish indigenous Japanese beliefs from Buddhism.

concept.name: sikhism
concept.definition: The religion of an Indian group, combining Hindu and Islamic elements, founded in the Punjab (or Panjab) in the late 15th century AD by Guru Nanak.

concept.name: jainism
concept.definition: A religion of India that teaches a path to spiritual purity and enlightenment through a disciplined mode of life founded upon the tradition of ahimsa, non-violence to all living creatures. It began in the 7th-5th century BC.

concept.name: parsasm
concept.definition: A religion in India following the Iranian prophet Zoroaster, mainly in Bombay, but also in Karachi (Pakistan).

concept.name: confucianism
concept.definition: The way of life propagated by Confucius in the 6th-5th century BC and followed by the Chinese people for more than 2000 years. Its influence has extended to Korea, Japan, and Vietnam.

concept.name: religious text
concept.definition: Scriptures holy or important for a church or religion

concept.name: bible
concept.definition: Sacred scriptures of Christianity consisting of the old and new testament

concept.name: qur'an
concept.definition: Holy book of Islam

concept.name: torah
concept.definition: Holy scriptures of Judaism

concept.name: interreligious dialogue
concept.definition: Any form of communication between religions

concept.name: religious event
concept.definition: News regarding a religious event but not a festival or holiday

concept.name: catholic convention
concept.definition: Reports concerning or from a catholic convention

concept.name: protestant convention
concept.definition: Reports concerning or from a protestant convention

concept.name: ritual
concept.definition: Established religious rituals such as mass, baptism, prayer meetings

concept.name: concordat
concept.definition: Treaty between the Holy See and another country for the regulation of ecclesiastical affairs in the territory of the latter

concept.name: ecumenism
concept.definition: Relations between christian churches

concept.name: science and technology
concept.definition: All aspects pertaining to human understanding of nature and the physical world and the development and application of this knowledge

concept.name: applied science
concept.definition: Stories about putting scientific knowledge to practical uses in the fields of the medical sciences, agriculture, domestic sciences as well as trades and crafts

concept.name: physics
concept.definition: The study of the properties and changes of matter

concept.name: chemistry
concept.definition: The study of the composition and reaction of substances

concept.name: cosmology
concept.definition: Study of the organization and structure of the universe

concept.name: particle physics
concept.definition: The study of elementary particles and atomic nuclei through the use of high-energy particles

concept.name: engineering
concept.definition: Stories about putting scientific knowledge to practical uses in the fields of civil, electrical, mechanical and chemical engineering

concept.name: material science
concept.definition: The study of materials used in manufacturing

concept.name: human science
concept.definition: Stories related to sociology, psychology, anthropology and political science

concept.name: social sciences
concept.definition: The study of people living in groups, as families, tribes and communities

concept.name: history
concept.definition: The study of human events of the past

concept.name: psychology
concept.definition: The study of the human mind and mental and emotional processes

concept.name: sociology
concept.definition: The study of human social relations, organization and change

concept.name: anthropology
concept.definition: The study of human beings in groups or societies

concept.name: natural science
concept.definition: Stories related to astronomy, astrophysics, physics, chemistry, earth sciences, palaeontology, biological sciences, botany and zoology, as well as mathematics

concept.name: geology
concept.definition: The study of Earth's physical processes

concept.name: paleontology
concept.definition: The study of ancient animals

concept.name: geography
concept.definition: The study of the surface of Earth and its political divisions

concept.name: botany
concept.definition: The study of plants

concept.name: zoology
concept.definition: The study of animals

concept.name: physiology
concept.definition: The study of vital processes of living organisms

concept.name: astronomy
concept.definition: The study of the stars and planets

concept.name: biology
concept.definition: The study of living organisms

concept.name: philosophical science
concept.definition: Stories related to philosophy, logic and ethics, among others

concept.name: research
concept.definition: Methodical investigation of events, procedures etc to explain why they occur, or to find solutions for problems

concept.name: survey
concept.definition: Examination of public attitudes on various subjects or issues, such as the quality of goods, the value of services etc.

concept.name: scientific exploration
concept.definition: Methodical land, sea and space journeys to discover new information about them

concept.name: space programme
concept.definition: The government's organized effort for the exploration of outer space and the bodies therein

concept.name: science (general)
concept.definition: Establishing and systematizing information about nature and the physical world through observation, experimentation and hypothesis

concept.name: technology (general)
concept.definition: The study of the practical or industrial arts, and applied sciences such as physics, hydrodynamics and thermodynamics

concept.name: rocketry
concept.definition: The development of rockets

concept.name: laser
concept.definition: The development and use of light amplification by stimulated emission of radiation

concept.name: standards
concept.definition: The rules, national and international, that govern science and technology. These might include international standards setting for equipment and interference standards.

concept.name: animal science
concept.definition: Science involving animals

concept.name: micro science
concept.definition: The multi-disciplinary areas of nanotechnology and Micro-Electrical Mechanical Systems.

concept.name: marine science
concept.definition: The multi-disciplinary research areas involving the worlds' waterways and oceans. This could include hyper-spectral sensing of ice flows, fisheries studies and underwater research.

concept.name: weather science
concept.definition: All scientific aspects of the weather and climate.

concept.name: electronics
concept.definition: The branch of engineering or physics concerned with the controlled flow of electrons or other carriers of electric charges, especially in semiconductor devices, including the design, manufacture, and maintenance of electronic devices

concept.name: identification technology
concept.definition: Includes biometrics, new computer-based identification cards, retinal scans, face scanning and mobile augmented reality systems (MARS) and other ways technology can identify individuals. Also technology vs. the privacy of personal information.

concept.name: mathematics
concept.definition: The study of quantities and shapes and their symbolic relationships.

concept.name: biotechnology
concept.definition: Manipulating natural organisms for scientific, medical or agricultural purposes

concept.name: agricultural research and technology
concept.definition: Pertaining to the growing of crops and management of farm animals

concept.name: nanotechnology
concept.definition: Manipulating objects at the molecular scale

concept.name: IT/computer sciences
concept.definition: The study and design of computer systems and networks.

concept.name: scientific institutions
concept.definition: Institutions that carry out or govern scientific work (e.g. National Academy of Arts and Sciences )

concept.name: social issue
concept.definition: Aspects of the behaviour of humans affecting the quality of life.

concept.name: addiction
concept.definition: The habitual and often uncontrollable use of harmful substances such as alcohol, tobacco and pharmaceuticals or drugs

concept.name: charity
concept.definition: Philanthropic giving

concept.name: demographics
concept.definition: The study of people and here they live and how they interact

concept.name: population and census
concept.definition: Population is the number of people in a geographical region and census is the process of counting them

concept.name: immigration
concept.definition: Movement of individuals from one country to the other

concept.name: illegal immigrants
concept.definition: Movement of individuals from one country to the other by illicit means

concept.name: emigrants
concept.definition: People who leave their country of origin, their relationship with their country of origin and their association with fellow emigrants

concept.name: disabled
concept.definition: Being incapacitated either physically, emotionally or mentally

concept.name: euthanasia (also includes assisted suicide)
concept.definition: Voluntary death with the aid of another

concept.name: suicide
concept.definition: Death by one's own hand

concept.name: family
concept.definition: A group of individuals related by blood or marriage

concept.name: parent and child
concept.definition: Two or more individuals with a hierarchical familial relationship

concept.name: adoption
concept.definition: A legal process of bringing a child with no supporting parents into a supportive union

concept.name: marriage
concept.definition: The union of two individuals who pledge fidelity, respect and support for each other

concept.name: divorce
concept.definition: The process by which a marriage is dissolved

concept.name: sex
concept.definition: The classification of individuals as either male or female. Or conjugal relationship between two individuals.

concept.name: courtship
concept.definition: Preliminaries of wooing and winning a partner

concept.name: family planning
concept.definition: Conscious decisions and efforts involving reproduction

concept.name: health insurance
concept.definition: Insurance covering extraordinary medical costs

concept.name: homelessness
concept.definition: Lacking a fixed place of residence

concept.name: minority group
concept.definition: A group of people classified by race, language, religion or other characteristic numerically smaller than others of the same classification

concept.name: gays and lesbians
concept.definition: Those that consider themselves attracted to their same gender in an erotic or sensual or similar way.

concept.name: national or ethnic minority
concept.definition: Groups of people that form a minority on ethnic or national basis, their status, problems and relations to the majority

concept.name: pornography
concept.definition: Audio or visual depictions of various sex related acts considered outside accepted community standards

concept.name: poverty
concept.definition: Having insufficient resources to provide for basic services to oneself or family

concept.name: prostitution
concept.definition: Sex for sale, either male or female, and those who profit from it

concept.name: racism
concept.definition: Harmful attitudes toward another group based on racial differences

concept.name: welfare
concept.definition: Generally government help for those in need of food, housing health and other services

concept.name: abortion
concept.definition: Usually the planned disruption of the process of reproduction of human life

concept.name: missing person
concept.definition: A person who is not where they are expected to be for a period of time

concept.name: missing due to hostilities
concept.definition: People, both civilian and military, missing during or after hostilities

concept.name: long term care
concept.definition: Extensive health care because of serious illness or disability

concept.name: juvenile delinquency
concept.definition: Incidents involving perpetrators who are minors.

concept.name: nuclear radiation victims
concept.definition: Includes antinuclear movements and compensation for atomic blast victims.

concept.name: slavery
concept.definition: The involuntary servitude, outside of legal incarceration for statuary criminal offences, of men, women and children, including involuntary unpaid labour, coerced actions, child labour

concept.name: abusive behaviour
concept.definition: The maltreatment of one or more individuals by others through dehumanizing treatment including sexual or mental abuse, deprivation of sensory abilities, deprivation of physical needs, physical mistreatment including beatings, and other forms of torture

concept.name: death and dying
concept.definition: Dying is the route to death. Death is the state you are in when there are no signs that you can function as a human being either physically or mentally

concept.name: people
concept.definition: Individuals as a whole, sometimes broken down into various classes, such as indigenous people, people of class etc

concept.name: children
concept.definition: Immature people, usually up to the age of puberty

concept.name: infants
concept.definition: Those people from birth until ages of one or two, usually when they begin walking

concept.name: teen-agers
concept.definition: People aged 13 to 19 years of age

concept.name: adults
concept.definition: People aged 20 and above

concept.name: senior citizens
concept.definition: People aged 60 or 65 and older

concept.name: social issues (general)
concept.definition: Issues affecting a number of individuals in their daily lives like housing, food, education, personal relationships

concept.name: social conditions
concept.definition: Conditions under which people live in terms of housing, water supply, availability of education

concept.name: social problems
concept.definition: Issues affecting the lives of individuals such as housing, education nutrition, communication etc

concept.name: discrimination
concept.definition: Denial of services to one or more people because of race, colour, sexual identity, religion, political beliefs etc

concept.name: social services
concept.definition: Government supported programs to improve the well-being of individuals or groups of individuals

concept.name: ordnance clearance
concept.definition: The removal or neutralization of ordnance such as landmines or cluster bombs, remaining after a war or armed conflict

concept.name: reconstruction
concept.definition: The reconstruction of economy, infrastructure and property, as well as life in general, after a war or natural disaster

concept.name: sport
concept.definition: Competitive exercise involving physical effort. Organizations and bodies involved in these activities.

concept.name: aero and aviation sport
concept.definition: Parachuting, freefall (parapente, delta-plane), gliding, aerostat, motorised flight (airplane, ultra light craft, helicopter)

concept.name: parachuting
concept.definition: Parachuting competitions: precision landings, voltige, individual and team

concept.name: sky diving
concept.definition: Parachuting competitions involving sky-diving

concept.name: alpine skiing
concept.definition: Skiing downhill on snow-covered slopes as fast as possible. The slopes contain intermediate gates which are spaced according to the discipline involved

concept.name: downhill
concept.definition: Skiing at top speed down a steep slope with interspersed turns but no gates. The fastest wins.

concept.name: giant slalom
concept.definition: Skiing down a slope, but with more turns and bends than in super-G skiing. The fastest wins.

concept.name: super G
concept.definition: Skiing down a steep slope, but with more turns and bends than in the downhill. The fastest wins.

concept.name: slalom
concept.definition: Skiers must zig-zag their way down a slope with closely positioned gates which they must negotiate. It is run over two legs with the combined fastest winning.

concept.name: combined
concept.definition: Race, usually competed over two days that combines a downhill leg and a slalom leg rewarding the most complete skiers. Combined fastest time wins.

concept.name: American football
concept.definition: Team ball game that opposes two teams that have attack sections and defence sections. Each attack goes up against the other defence and attempts to move an oval-shaped ball down the field and into the end-zone to mark a touchdown and earn points.

concept.name: (US) National Football League (NFL) (North American)
concept.definition: The association of professional American football teams

concept.name: CFL
concept.definition: The Canadian Football League (CFL), also known as Ligue Canadienne de Football (LCF), is a professional league located entirely in Canada that plays Canadian football.

concept.name: AFL-DEPRECATED
concept.definition: The American Football League (AFL) was a professional league of American football that operated from 1960 to 1969. In 1970, the AFL merged with the National Football League.

concept.name: archery
concept.definition: Archers use bows and arrows to aim at targets 1.22 metres in diameter which are on average 70 metres distant.

concept.name: FITA / Outdoor target archery
concept.definition: The competition is held outdoors on an open (flat) field, at various fixed distances. The archery competition in the Olympic Games is a part of the FITA outdoor target archery program.

concept.name: crossbow shooting
concept.definition: Shooting with crossbow on targets from different distances

concept.name: athletics, track and field
concept.definition: Competitions involving foot races, jumping and throwing which can be on a track inside a stadium or on outside roads

concept.name: 100 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 100 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 200 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 200 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 400 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 400 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 800 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 800 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 1000 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 1000 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 1500 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 1000 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: mile
concept.definition: Running over a distance of one mile with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 2000 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 2000 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 3000 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 3000 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 5000 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 5000 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 10,000 m
concept.definition: Running over a distance of 10,000 metres with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 20 km
concept.definition: Walking over a distance of 20 km on public roads with the fastest time winning

concept.name: one hour
concept.definition: Walking as far as possible in the time of one hour
Walking over a distance of 25km with the fastest time winning
Walking over a distance of 30kms with the fastest time winning

concept.name: 110 m hurdles
concept.definition: Race consisting of covering 110 metres as fast as possible while jumping over 10 hurdles placed on the track

concept.name: 400 m hurdles
concept.definition: Race consisting of covering 400 metres as fast as possible while jumping over 10 hurdles placed on the track

concept.name: 3000 m steeplechase
concept.definition: Race consisting of covering 3000 metres as fast as possible while jumping over 28 hurdles which are 91/4 centimetres high and seven water obstacles

concept.name: high jump
concept.definition: Competitors jump as high as possible over a bar which is raised each time they clear the height. The highest clearance wins.

concept.name: pole vault
concept.definition: Competitors use a flexible pole to propel themselves feet-first into the air and clear a bar which is raised higher at each round of jumps.

concept.name: long jump
concept.definition: Competitors build up speed over a short sprint and them attempt to jump as far forward as they can from a given point into sand trap. The longest jump wins.

concept.name: triple jump
concept.definition: Competitors build up speed over a short sprint and then attempt to jump as far forward as they can using a hop, skip and a jump technique. The longest jump wins.

concept.name: shot put
concept.definition: Competitors stand in a circle with a 2.13 metres diameter and attempt to throw a metal ball weighing 7.26 kg for men and 4kg for women as far as possible. The longest throw wins.

concept.name: discus throw
concept.definition: Competitors stand in a netted circle with a 2.50 metres diameter and with a turning motion attempt to throw a discus weighing 2kg for men and 1kg for women as far as possible. The longest throw wins.

concept.name: hammer throw
concept.definition: Competitors throw a hammer consisting of a metal ball, chain and handle as far as they can from a netted circle which is 2.13 metres in diameter. The hammer weighs 7.26 kg for men and 4 kg for women.

concept.name: javelin throw
concept.definition: Competitors in a specially-designated throwing area attempt to fling a spear-like javelin as far as possible. The javelin weighs 800 grammes for men and 600 grammes for women.

concept.name: decathlon
concept.definition: Individual men's competition which involves accumulating points in 10 different disciplines over two days: 1st day - 100m, long-jump, shot-putt, high-jump, 400m. 2nd day - 110m hurdles, discus, pole-vault, javelin and 1,500 metres.

concept.name: 4x100 m
concept.definition: Team race involving four runners each covering 100 metres.

concept.name: 4x200 m
concept.definition: Team race involving four runners each covering 200 metres.

concept.name: 4x400 m
concept.definition: Team race involving four runners each covering 400 metres.

concept.name: 4x800 m
concept.definition: Team race involving four runners each covering 800 metres.

concept.name: 4x1500 m
concept.definition: Team race involving four runners each covering 1500 metres.

concept.name: walk 1 h
concept.definition: One-hour long race where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: walk 2 h
concept.definition: Two-hour long walking race where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: 10 km walk
concept.definition: Walking race over 10 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: 15 km walk
concept.definition: Walking race over 15 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: 20 km walk
concept.definition: Walking race over 20 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: 30 km walk
concept.definition: Walking race over 30 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: 50 km walk
concept.definition: Walking race over 50 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: 100 m hurdles
concept.definition: Sprint over a distance of 110 metres with competitors having to clear 10 hurdles placed in their way.

concept.name: 5 km walk
concept.definition: Walking race over 5 kilometres where competitors must maintain at least one foot in contact with the ground and are not allowed to run.

concept.name: heptathlon

concept.name: badminton
concept.definition: Two players or two teams of two compete by hitting a shuttlecock weighing approximately five grams over a high net. The aim for each player/team is to prevent the shuttlecock landing on their side of the court.

concept.name: baseball
concept.definition: A game between two teams of nine played on an enclosed ground. The team which scores the most points wins. A point is scored when a player runs around the ground marked out by four bases.

concept.name: Major League Baseball (North American Professional) - American League
concept.definition: Baseball league comprising 14 teams.

concept.name: Major League Baseball (North American Professional) - National League
concept.definition: Baseball league comprising 16 teams.

concept.name: Major League Baseball (North American Professional) - Special (e.g. All-Star, World Series)
concept.definition: Baseball competition other than the World Series.

concept.name: rubberball baseball
concept.definition: Sometimes called ''soft baseball,'' the game is played with a rubber baseball of varying degrees of hardness depending upon the age and level of the players.

concept.name: Major League Baseball Playoffs
concept.definition: Consists of several rounds of play to determine representatives to the U.S.-based World Series

concept.name: World Series
concept.definition: U.S.-based annual series of games between the top two teams of Major League Baseball to determine the overall champion

concept.name: basketball
concept.definition: Game played between two teams of five - points are scored by placing the large inflated ball into a net fixed on a ring 3.05m above the ground.

concept.name: National Basketball Association (North American Professional)
concept.definition: The NBA is the umbrella organisation running professional basketball in the United States. The NBA is made up of two conferences (east and west), four divisions (Atlantic and Central for the East, and Midwest and Pacific for the west).

concept.name: professional - Women general
concept.definition: women's professional league

concept.name: Swiss netball
concept.definition: Similar to Basketball. Basket without a board. Mainly executed by women

concept.name: German netball
concept.definition: Same as Swiss Netball, but with specific German rules

concept.name: Dutch netball
concept.definition: Same as Swiss Netball, but with specific Dutch rule

concept.name: biathlon

concept.name: 7.5 km
concept.definition: Timed cross country skiing race. Competitors set off at 30sec intervals for three circuits totalling 7.5km.

concept.name: 10 km
concept.definition: Sprint races for men, pursuit for women.

concept.name: 15 km
concept.definition: Individual women's race in sprint format staged over three laps with competitors setting off at intervals of a minute.

concept.name: 20 km
concept.definition: Individual men's race in sprint format staged over five laps with competitors setting off at intervals of a minute.

concept.name: 4x7.5 km relay
concept.definition: Teams consisting of four biathletes with each team covering a distance of 7.5km with two rounds of target shooting.

concept.name: 12.5 km pursuit
concept.definition: The start is determined by the results from the sprint. A race held over five laps with target shooting (standing or prone)

concept.name: billiards, snooker and pool
concept.definition: A game played on a flat table covered with a cloth (baize) where players hit balls according to specific rules using a wooden cue.

concept.name: 8 ball
concept.definition: A game using 15 balls and a white. The first player aims to pot the balls numbered 1-7 (solids) with the second player potting balls 9-15 (stripes). After that the first player to pot the black wins.

concept.name: 9 ball
concept.definition: A game played with nine balls numbered 1-9, and a white. On each turn the player must hit the lowest numbered ball.

A player nominates the ball he is attempting to pot and into which pocket. He collects points for each successful hit. He continues until he makes a mistake. Before hitting the 15th ball, the 14 reds are set up again in the triangle.

concept.name: continuous-DEPRECATED

concept.name: bobsleigh
concept.definition: In bobsleigh two or four persons race down a course sitting in a sled that consists of a main hull, a frame, two axles and sets of runners. The total time of all heats in a competition is added together to determine the winner.

concept.name: two-man sled

concept.name: four-man sled

concept.name: bowling

concept.name: bowls and petanque
concept.definition: A game in which players throw bowls at a target, the winner being the player who lands closest.

concept.name: boxing

concept.definition: races in either 'white' or 'dead' water

concept.name: Slalom
concept.definition: White water course set out with gates consisting of two poles suspended vertically over the water. Competitors must negotiate the gates or face penalties

concept.name: K2
concept.definition: an enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for two people using double bladed paddles.

concept.name: K4
concept.definition: an enclosed boat with the competitor sitting on a fixed seat for four people using double bladed paddles.

concept.name: C1
concept.definition: One-seater canoe (open boat with competitor using a single bladed paddle.

concept.name: C2
concept.definition: Two-seater canoe (open boat) - competitors use a single bladed paddle.

concept.name: C4
concept.definition: Four-seater canoe (open boat) with each competitor using a single bladed paddle.

concept.name: canoe sailing
concept.definition: A race involving a canoe equipped with a sail.

concept.name: pontoniering
concept.definition: Team sport, military tradition, similar to canoe regatta, in boats

concept.name: climbing
concept.definition: mountain sports

concept.name: mountaineering
concept.definition: Alpine climbing

concept.name: sport climbing
concept.definition: Sport climbing as a special category: individual competition, on an artificial wall with time measurement

concept.name: cricket
concept.definition: Ball sport involving two teams of 11 players, balls, bats and wickets. The aim is to score as many runs as possible, and to get the opposing team 'out'. A 'run' involves a player running between two wickets. The opposing team try to get their rivals 'out'

concept.name: curling
concept.definition: A game played on ice with large flat round stones. A player throws the stone, aiming at a target. Team mates of the player who has thrown the stone can sweep the ice in front of the stone to help smooth its path towards the target.

concept.name: icestock sport
concept.definition: Similar to curling, played on targets on ice, different stones with straight handle and different rules, played in alpine countries

concept.name: cycling
concept.definition: A race over a given distance on bicycles.

concept.name: track
concept.definition: A race staged on a track in a velodrome

concept.name: pursuit
concept.definition: Two cyclists or teams set off from midway down opposite straights and try to make up the gap between them.

concept.name: Olympic sprint
concept.definition: Qualifying race held over 200m. From the quarter-finals two cyclists go head-to-heads. By teams races consist of three cyclists from different countries.

concept.name: sprint
concept.definition: Races between two cyclists over two or three laps, with a timed sprint finish over the last 200m.

concept.name: Keirin
concept.definition: Sprint between six cyclists where a pacemaker on a moped gradually increases the pace over the first 1400m. When the pacemaker leaves the track the race develops into a sprint finish over the final 6-700m.

concept.name: points race
concept.definition: Cyclists aim to complete the highest number of laps. Bonus points are picked up in intermediate sprints held every 2500m.

concept.name: Madison race
concept.definition: A points race by teams comprising two cyclists in relay-format.

concept.name: 500 m time trial
concept.definition: Individual race against the clock over 500m for women.

concept.name: 1 km time trial
concept.definition: Individual race over 1000m against the clock for men.

concept.name: one hour
concept.definition: Competitors aim to complete as many kilometres as possible in one hour.

concept.name: road race
concept.definition: Road race with all the competitor starting en masse.

concept.name: road time trial
concept.definition: A race or stage against the clock with each cyclist setting off individually.

concept.name: staging race
concept.definition: A race disputed by teams with the classifications determined by the combined times over a day.

concept.name: cyclo-cross
concept.definition: Staged on various surfaces - earth, grass, sand or tarmac.

concept.name: Vtt
concept.definition: mountain bikes

concept.name: Vtt-cross
concept.definition: An endurance race on mountain bikes around a 10km circuit over various terrain and with different degrees of slopes. Competitors are not allowed any exterior help.

concept.name: Vtt-downhill
concept.definition: Individual mountain bike race against the clock staged on a downhill circuit featuring obstacles.

concept.name: bi-crossing
concept.definition: A race where competitors have to cover a circuit with obstacles as quickly as possible.

concept.name: trial
concept.definition: A timed race in which competitors on mountain bikes must negotiate tricky terrain and obstacles without putting their feet down.

concept.name: artistic cycling
concept.definition: Individual or teams on one or two bicycles in an arena. Points are awarded by a jury.

concept.name: cycle ball
concept.definition: Competitive team sport using bicycles. One team against another with two persons per team. The aim is for competitors to move the ball using the front and rear wheels without letting their feet touch the ground.

concept.name: dancing
concept.definition: Dancing competition where couples are judged on technique and interpretation.

concept.name: diving
concept.definition: Competitors dive off a fixed or spring board and are assessed by seven judges giving marks up to ten for their acrobatic moves.

concept.name: 10 m platform
concept.definition: Divers take off from a ten metre high platform.

concept.name: 10 m platform synchronised
concept.definition: Two competitors from the same team dive off at the same time from separate platforms. As well as being judged on the standard criteria they are also awarded marks for synchronisation.

concept.name: 3 m springboard
concept.definition: Divers dive from a three-metre high springboard.

concept.name: 3 m springboard synchronised
concept.definition: Two competitors from the same team dive off at the same time from separate three-metre high springboards. As well as being judged on the standard criteria they are also awarded marks for synchronisation.

concept.name: subaquatics
concept.definition: Sports like hockey held under water

concept.name: scuba diving
concept.definition: Diving into different depths, with time measurement

concept.name: equestrian
concept.definition: Sport involving a horse and rider.

concept.name: three-day event
concept.definition: Equestrian event involving three disciplines - Dressage, cross-country and show jumping.

concept.name: dressage
concept.definition: A rider is judged on a series of moves at three different paces - walk, trot and gallop.

concept.name: jumping
concept.definition: A rider and horse attempt to jump a series of obstacles in an enclosed arena against the clock.

concept.name: cross country
concept.definition: Equestrian event held on a designated circuit in the countryside featuring artificial and natural obstacles.

concept.name: fencing
concept.definition: Combat sport using a sword or foil.

concept.name: epee
concept.definition: category of fencing using a weapon with a triangular cross-section blade and a large bell guard.

concept.name: foil
concept.definition: category of fencing using a weapon with a rectangular cross-section blade and a small bell guard.

concept.name: sabre
concept.definition: a fencing weapon with a flat blade and knuckle guard used with cutting or thrusting moves.

concept.name: field Hockey
concept.definition: A ball sport involving two teams of 11 players using curved sticks. The aim is to score as many goals as possible.

concept.name: roll hockey
concept.definition: Team sport similar to ice hockey, executed on 4 wheel roller skates with sticks and a ball

concept.name: figure Skating
concept.definition: To obtain the best marks possible from nine judges who award scores after two prepared sections - both skated to music - during which competitors must attempt to achieve the greatest possible harmony between artistic flair and technical precision.

concept.name: singles
concept.definition: The individual events comprise a short program which counts for 33.3% of the score, and the free skate which is worth 66.7%.

concept.name: pairs
concept.definition: The pairs event comprise a short program which counts for 33.3% of the score, and the free skate which is worth 66.7%.

concept.name: ice dance
concept.definition: Takes place over three days with, in order, two compulsory dances, the original dance (2min 30sec) and the free dance (4min).

concept.name: freestyle Skiing
concept.definition: Competitors perform a series of breathtaking acrobatic leaps from a prepared jump. Combined with moguls, jumps and ski ballet.

concept.name: moguls
concept.definition: Contestants attack a heavily moguled slope, performing technically challenging turns and jumps, while maintaining the most direct line from the top to the bottom of the hill.

concept.name: aerials
concept.definition: Competitors perform a series of aerial twists and turns from a prepared jump.

concept.name: artistic skiing
concept.definition: Competitors perform a series of artistic moves (jumps and twists) all set to music. The use of ski poles is permitted.

concept.name: golf
concept.definition: Competitors attempt to hit a small white ball with different clubs around a course of 18 holes varying in distance. The object is to make the fewest strokes possible.

concept.name: gymnastics
concept.definition: A sport consisting of a variety of disciplines in which gymnasts perform artistic and acrobatic moves on different apparatus. There are 6 disciplines for men and 4 for women.

concept.name: floor exercise
concept.definition: A gymnastics floor exercise on a 12m/sq matt.

concept.name: vault
concept.definition: gymnasts propel themselves by jumping on a trampoline after running quickly down a 25m lane

concept.name: pommel horse
concept.definition: Gymnasts perform an uninterrupted swing motion over a handled horse using balance and strength.

concept.name: uneven bars
concept.definition: Gymnasts run through an airborne routine swinging around and between the uneven bars.

concept.name: parallel bars
concept.definition: Gymnasts swing and turn with guile and grace around the parallel bars.

concept.name: horizontal bar
concept.definition: Gymnasts turn, spin and perform pirouettes around the horizontal bar.

concept.name: rings
concept.definition: Gymnasts perform feats of balance and strength from two suspended rings.

concept.name: beam
concept.definition: Gymnasts perform leaps and flips from the much feared balance beam just 10 cm wide.

concept.name: rhythmic
concept.definition: A mixture of dance and gymnastic moves.

concept.name: clubs
concept.definition: Dance and gymnastic moves whilst juggling clubs.

concept.name: hoop
concept.definition: A hoop is rolled and thrown whilst performing a dance routine.

concept.name: ribbon
concept.definition: Gymnasts work through a pre-arranged routine whilst manipulating a spectacular length of ribbon.

concept.name: rope
concept.definition: Jump and figure movements are performed while a rope is manipulated.

concept.name: ball
concept.definition: An exercise based on suppleness of the body using a ball.

concept.name: trampoline
concept.definition: Competitors perform complicated twists and turns whilst bouncing on the trampoline.

concept.name: handball (team)
concept.definition: A ball game using the hands contested by two teams of seven trying to throw the ball into the opponents goal.

concept.name: horse racing, harness racing
concept.definition: Mounted horse races.

concept.name: flat racing
concept.definition: A horse race over a flat course.

concept.name: steeple chase
concept.definition: A mounted horse race over at least eight classic obstacles, four of which must be different, such as the water jump, spruce fences, mud walls etc.

concept.name: trotting
concept.definition: Horses pitched to a jockeyed buggy race in a trot round a flat course.

concept.name: cross country
concept.definition: A long distance race including rustic obstacles such as real fences, streams and fallen trees.

concept.name: ice hockey
concept.definition: Two teams of six heavily padded skaters try and outscore each other by hitting a puck into the opponents goal.

concept.name: National Hockey League (North American)
concept.definition: Teams from the US and Canada make up the North American continents top league.

concept.name: sledge hockey
concept.definition: Like ice hockey but instead of skates small sledges are used. Competitors move by pushing with the arms

concept.name: Jai Alai (Pelota)
concept.definition: Because of the game organization, the proper identification of a specific game may require the combination of 2 subject details

concept.name: fronton
concept.definition: The "fronton" known as "Fronton Place Libre" consists of a rectangular outdoor court plus a large pink shaped wall at one end. The two sides and the other end are left opened.

concept.name: jai-alai
concept.definition: A "Ja-Alai" is an indoor fronton with a 56 meters long court which is used exclusively to play "chistera-ancha". Three walls are used in the game: the front, the back and the left hand wall.

concept.name: left wall
concept.definition: A "fronton with left hand wall" is an indoor fronton with a 36 meters long court where Pala or Main Nue are played. Three walls are used in the game: the front, the back and the left hand wall.

concept.name: trinquet
concept.definition: A "Trinquet" is an indoor fronton with a 28.5 meters long court surrounded by four walls. The four walls are used in the game.

concept.name: rebot
concept.definition: The "rebot" is the game played in a fronton "place libre" with 5 players in each team. They use a "chistera" (56 cm long and 12 cm large) or bare hands.

concept.name: chistera ancha
concept.definition: The "chistera-ancha" also called the "cesta punta" is the game played in a "ja alai" with 1 or 2 players in each team. The players use a long curved basket called the "chistera" (68 cm long and 13 cm wide).

concept.name: chistera corta
concept.definition: The "chistera-corta" is the game played in a fronton "place libre" with left hand wall and 3 players in each team. The players use a long curved basket called the "chistera" (56 cm long and 12 cm wide).

concept.name: bare hand
concept.definition: The "Main Nue" (bare hand) is the ancestor of all Basque sports.

concept.name: pala-ancha
concept.definition: The "pala-ancha" is the game played in a fronton "place libre" with 2 players in each team. The players use a heavy wooden bat "the pala" (50 cm long and 20 cm wide).

concept.name: pala-corta
concept.definition: The "pala-corta" is the game played in a fronton with left hand wall and 2 players in each team. The players use a heavy wooden bat the "pala-corta" (50 cm long and 10 cm wide). The "pala" is the name for a heavy wooden bat.

concept.name: pasaka
concept.definition: The "pasaka" is the name of the game played in a trinquet by teams of 2 players facing each other on each side of a net where the pelota is hit between opponents.

concept.name: xare
concept.definition: The "xare", is the name of the game played in a trinquet by teams of 2 players. The players use a "xare" (or the Argentina bat) 55 cm long and 16 cm wide.

concept.name: judo
concept.definition: A defensive martial art.

concept.name: heavyweight
concept.definition: Open but usually over 100kg for men and over 78kg for women

concept.name: half-heavyweight
concept.definition: Up to 100kg for men and 78kg for women.

concept.name: middleweight
concept.definition: Up to 90kg for men and 70kg for women.

concept.name: half-middleweight
concept.definition: UP to 81kg for men and 63kg for women.

concept.name: half-lightweight
concept.definition: Up to 73kg for men and 57kg for women.

concept.name: lightweight
concept.definition: up to 66kg for men and 52kg for women.

concept.name: extra lightweight
concept.definition: Up to 60kg for men and 48kg for women.

concept.name: karate
concept.definition: A martial art where chops, punches, kicks and throws are used to defeat an opponent.

concept.name: sparring

concept.name: singles
concept.definition: individual time trial event in a one seater luge

concept.name: doubles

concept.name: marathon
concept.definition: A road race where competitors run 42.195km, generally through city streets

concept.name: modern pentathlon

concept.name: rallying
concept.definition: Stage races

concept.name: pursuit
concept.definition: Cross-country race with mass start, first half of the distance in classic and the other half in free style.

concept.name: rallycross
concept.definition: Stage races over dirt tracks

concept.name: motorcycling
concept.definition: Races with 2, 3 or 4 wheels vehicles with a saddle and handlebars

concept.name: speed-Grand-Prix
concept.definition: A fast and furious race where every second counts

concept.name: enduro

concept.name: moto-ball

concept.name: moto-cross

concept.name: rallying

concept.name: endurance
concept.definition: A road race of consistency and endurance

concept.name: motoGP
concept.definition: Capacity class 1000ccm

concept.name: netball
concept.definition: A woman's sport similar to basketball without a board behind the basket

concept.name: nordic skiing
concept.definition: Practiced in snowy countryside and based on power and endurance. There are classic and free style events with mass or staggered starts.

concept.name: cross-country

concept.definition: A 5km classic race in that the competitor keeps his skis parallel except on steep inclines where the scissor move is used

concept.name: 10 km classical style
concept.definition: A 10km classic race in that the competitor keeps his skis parallel except on steep inclines where the scissor move is used

concept.name: 10 km pursuit free style
concept.definition: Staggered start depending on positions with competitors using a skating like technique on skis

concept.name: 15 km classical style
concept.definition: A 15km race using the classical style of keeping skies parallel

concept.name: 15 km pursuit free style
concept.definition: 15km race with staggered start using free style technique similar to a skating motion

concept.name: 10 km + 15 km combined
concept.definition: 10km classic followed by 15km free-style race

concept.name: 30 km classical style
concept.definition: A 30km classic race in that the competitor keeps his skis parallel except on steep inclines where the scissor move is used

concept.name: 30km free style
concept.definition: A 30km free-style race where the most common style is the skate style where competitors slide and the skis do not need to be parallel

concept.name: 50 km free style
concept.definition: A 50km free style race where the most common style is the skate style where competitors slide and the skis do not need to be parallel

concept.name: 4x5 km relay
concept.definition: Teams of four competitors ski 5km each in relay fashion

concept.name: 4x10 km relay
concept.definition: Teams of four competitors ski 10km each in relay fashion

concept.name: nordic combined
concept.definition: A two day competition combining the ski jump and a cross-country race.

concept.name: raid
concept.definition: NA

concept.name: 5 km pursuit free style
concept.definition: Cross-country skiing over a 5km course in a pursuit format

concept.name: 1.5 km sprint free
concept.definition: Cross-country skiing over a 1.5km course in a sprint format

concept.name: 50 km classic style
concept.definition: Cross-country skiing over a 50km course in a classic style format

concept.name: orienteering
concept.definition: An individual time-trial over a route marked out by beacons. The competitor has to search out and find in a specific order. The contestant makes his way with the help of a compass and map

concept.name: ski orienteering
concept.definition: An individual ski time-trial over a route marked out by beacons, that the competitor has to search out and find in a specific order. The contestant makes his way with the help of a compass and map

concept.name: polo
concept.definition: With the aid of a mallet two teams of four horsemen try and knock a bamboo ball into the opponents goal over a pitch 250m long and 150m wide. The game is divided into 4, 6, or 8 time periods of 7min 30sec called chukkas.

concept.name: power boating
concept.definition: Races between motor boats on rivers or lakes

concept.name: F1
concept.definition: Sprint race

concept.name: F2
concept.definition: Long distance race

concept.name: rowing
concept.definition: Boat racing usually on flat calm waters with boats for 1, 2, 4 or 8 rowers

concept.name: single sculls
concept.definition: Single person boats with two oars

concept.name: double sculls
concept.definition: Two person boats with two oars each

concept.name: quadruple sculls
concept.definition: Four person boats with two oars each and without a team mate to give directions

concept.name: coxless pair
concept.definition: Two person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

concept.name: coxless four
concept.definition: Four person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

concept.name: eight
concept.definition: Eight person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

concept.name: lightweight
concept.definition: Where a weight category is imposed on competitors

concept.name: rugby league
concept.definition: Two teams of 13 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

concept.name: rugby union
concept.definition: Two teams of 15 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

concept.name: rugby 7
concept.definition: A more fun and exciting variety where two teams of 7 compete on a pitch where they score tries and penalties by running with and passing an oval ball to be touched down behind the goal line or kicked between goal posts in a tough physical contest

concept.name: sailing
concept.definition: Sail boat racing over a route marked by buoys.

concept.definition: Boat Category: two man catamaran (21m/sq mainsail) Olympic sport

concept.name: soling

concept.name: yngling
concept.definition: Olympic boat-class. A race around different courses in a boat of 6.35 metres (20ft 10in) long and 1.73 metres (5ft 8in) wide, crewed in Olympic competition only by women. The number of races and the length of the courses varies.

concept.name: mistral
concept.definition: Olympic boat class. A staged race using boats of the mistral type, which are 4.24 metres (13ft 11in) long and 1.3 metres (4ft 3in) wide. The number of races and the length of the courses varies.

concept.name: ski jumping
concept.definition: Competitors descend a snow covered elevated ramp on skis and try to fly off it as far as possible, receiving marks for distance, style of flight and landing

concept.name: K90 jump
concept.definition: Competitors jump from 70m and must clear 90m distance in their jump before scoring points for it

concept.name: K120 jump
concept.definition: Competitors jump from 90m and must clear 120m distance in their jump before scoring points for it

concept.name: soccer
concept.definition: Two teams of eleven try to kick or head a ball into the opponents goal over a match usually of 90 minutes

concept.name: softball
concept.definition: Similar to baseball but with a larger and softer ball, a thinner bat, shorter gaps between bases and less innings

concept.name: squash
concept.definition: A racket sport of strategy and endurance played by singles or doubles teams in a walled court with a small rubber ball

concept.name: sumo wrestling
concept.definition: A combat sport of speed and rapidity with much ceremony where two contestants try to throw or slap a competitor out of a marked area. Generally practiced in Japan by large men.

concept.name: surfing
concept.definition: Water sport where contestants catch and ride waves upright on a surfboard

concept.name: swimming
concept.definition: A water sport where contestants swim as fast as possible in a given style and win races by being the first to touch home

concept.name: 50 m freestyle
concept.definition: Competitors cover 50m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

concept.name: 100 m freestyle
concept.definition: Competitors cover 100m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

concept.name: 200 m freestyle
concept.definition: Competitors cover 200m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

concept.name: 400 m freestyle
concept.definition: Competitors cover 400m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

concept.name: 800 m freestyle
concept.definition: Competitors cover 800m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

concept.name: 1500 m freestyle
concept.definition: Competitors cover 1500m in any style, though front crawl is universally employed

concept.name: relay 4x50 m freestyle
concept.definition: Teams of four swimmers cover 50m freestyle in a 200m race

concept.name: relay 4x100 m freestyle
concept.definition: Teams of four swimmers cover 100m freestyle in a 400m race

concept.name: relay 4x200 m freestyle
concept.definition: Teams of four swimmers cover 200m freestyle in a 800m race

concept.name: 50 m backstroke
concept.definition: Competitors cover 50m in the backstroke style

concept.name: 100 m backstroke
concept.definition: Competitors cover 100m in the backstroke style

concept.name: 200 m backstroke
concept.definition: Competitors cover 200m in the backstroke style

concept.name: 50 m breaststroke
concept.definition: A 50m race in the breaststroke style, on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

concept.name: 100 m breaststroke
concept.definition: A 100m race in the breaststroke style, on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

concept.name: 200 m breaststroke
concept.definition: A 200m race in the breaststroke style, on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

concept.name: 50 m butterfly
concept.definition: A 50m butterfly race, swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles.

concept.name: 100 m butterfly
concept.definition: A 100m butterfly race, swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles

concept.name: 200 m butterfly
concept.definition: A 200m butterfly race, swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles

concept.name: 100 m medley
concept.definition: Swimmers complete four laps, each in a different style and in this order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke and freestyle, covering a total of 100m.

concept.name: 200 m medley
concept.definition: Swimmers complete four laps, each in a different style and in this order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke and freestyle, covering a total of 200m.

concept.name: 400 m medley
concept.definition: Swimmers complete eight laps, two in each style and in this order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke and freestyle, covering a total of 400m.

concept.name: relay 4x50 m medlay
concept.definition: A relay team of four, each of whom completes a single lap and each in a different style in this order: backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly and freestyle in a race of 200m total.

concept.name: relay4x100 m medley
concept.definition: A relay team of four, each of whom completes two laps and each in a different style in this order: backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly and freestyle in a race of 400m total.

concept.name: short course
concept.definition: Races competed in a 25m length pool

concept.name: synchronised technical routine
concept.definition: Contestants obtain points from 10 sitting judges by executing certain synchronised artistic shapes and movements in the water. In the technical programme, competitors must execute a range of specific moves in a given order.

concept.name: synchronised free routine
concept.definition: In the free programme, music, movements and their order of execution are not restricted.

concept.definition: A racket sport for two or four (in doubles), who compete at a table divided by a net using a small bat to play a lightweight ball

concept.name: tennis

concept.name: soft tennis
concept.definition: Tennis with a soft rubber ball. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

concept.name: triathlon
concept.definition: An endurance multi-sport where competitors first swim, then cycle and then run a road race. Distances vary according to the competition, the Olympic version being 1.5, 40 and 10km respectively.

concept.name: volleyball

concept.name: beach volleyball
concept.definition: Two teams of two players compete on a sand court. Unlike indoor volleyball, points are scored only when the serving team wins a rally or forces an error. The sand surface makes it more physically demanding than volleyball.

concept.name: water polo
concept.definition: Played in a pool between two teams of 7, who must stay afloat and can only use one hand to pass the ball or swim with it before trying to throw it into the opponents net to score goals.

concept.name: water skiing

concept.name: combined

concept.definition: Rodeo discipline
