concept.name: mini golf sport
concept.definition: A game where balls must be holed on an artificial course in as few strokes from the club as possible

concept.name: bandy
concept.definition: Played outdoors on ice. The size of the ice rink is about the size of a soccer field. Skates like ice hockey. A small hard ball is used for playing. Players play with sticks, much like in ice hockey, but the sticks are shorter and more rounded.

concept.name: flying disc
concept.definition: A group of events all played with a flying plastic disc. The exact regulation for the disc is different in different events but it has to be unbroken of solid plastic and a production model with no modification. Flying disc is sometimes called Frisbee.

concept.name: ultimate
concept.definition: Team game. Played outdoors on soccer-size field with 7 players per team and indoors with 5 players per team. Games are played to a preset number of goals. Goals are scored by passing the disc to a team-member catching it inside the goal area.

concept.name: guts
concept.definition: Team game where two teams of 5 players each face each other. Teams take turns to throw the disc towards the other team. Points are scored if the opposing team does not catch the disc.

concept.name: overall
concept.definition: Not an event in itself but in most competitions with individual events the winner of the competition will be awarded to the player with the highest combined score in the events.

concept.name: distance
concept.definition: The object is to throw the disc as far as possible. Each player get five throws per turn. Throws are made downwind. World record is over 200 meters.

concept.name: discathon
concept.definition: The object is to throw and run a park course of about 1 kilometre. Four players compete in each heat. They have two discs each. They may also carry a third disc in reserve. Where one thrown disc stops the second disc must be thrown.

concept.name: DDC
concept.definition: Abbreviation for Double Disc Court. Two players per team in a square 13x13 metre. The teams start with one disc per team and throw at each other. Discs are thrown back and forth until one or both hit the ground.

concept.name: SCF
concept.definition: Abbreviation for Self Caught Flights. Divided into two sub events called MTA (Maximum Time Aloft) and TRC (Throw Run Catch). In both sub events the player throws a disc and then runs to catch it with one hand before it hits the ground.

concept.name: freestyle
concept.definition: A judged event where groups of two or three players perform as many tricks as possible. In competitions the judges can use either a ranking system or set scores on presentation, execution and difficulty.

concept.name: accuracy
concept.definition: Each player has 28 throws from various distances and angles to throw the disc through a goal 1.5 x 1.5 meters. World record is 25 of 28 possible.

concept.name: disc golf
concept.definition: Much like golf but played with discs instead of balls and clubs. Instead of a hole in the ground there is a metal basket with light metal chains to throw the disc at. Players often carry discs specialized for long throws, right or left bends.

concept.name: floorball
concept.definition: Played indoors in a court the size of a basketball court. 6 players per team, of which one is a who plays in a kneeling position without a stick like in ice hockey. The other players use plastic clubs and a light plastic ball to pass and shoot goals.

concept.name: casting
concept.definition: Using fishing equipment to hit a target and score points

concept.name: tug-of-war
concept.definition: Two teams pulling against each other on a rope

concept.name: croquette
concept.definition: Using mallets to hit a ball through hoops

concept.name: dog racing
concept.definition: Dogs racing around a track

concept.name: sled
concept.definition: Harnessed to a sled

concept.name: oval track
concept.definition: Pursuing an artificial rabbit around an oval track

concept.name: skeleton
concept.definition: In skeleton the competitor lays on his/hers stomach when racing down the course. The competitor must be on the sled when crossing the finishing line. The total time of all races in a competition is added together.

concept.name: Australian rules football
concept.definition: Football played under Australian rules

concept.name: Canadian football
concept.definition: Football played under Canadian rules

concept.name: duathlon
concept.definition: Duathlon

concept.name: hornuss
concept.definition: Swiss team sport with 16 or 18 men per team. A rubber puck is hit towards the field of the adversary team which tries to hit the puck in the air with a wooden board thrown in the air

concept.name: fist ball
concept.definition: Men's team sport similar to volleyball (with a much lower net) executed mainly in gymnastics clubs

concept.name: inline skating
concept.definition: Competitive sports using inline skates

concept.name: grass ski
concept.definition: Alpine skiing on roller skis and grass

concept.name: snowbiking
concept.definition: Individual sport on snow on a snow bike, the athlete has two mini skis, previous name: ski bob

concept.name: twirling
concept.definition: Team competition with majorettes and a jury

concept.name: kendo
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo sword, sometimes called Japanese fencing. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

concept.name: jukendo
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a model rifle made of wood. "Juken" means a rifle or gun with blade (bayonet). (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

concept.name: naginata
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a pole sword made of wood. "Naginata" means a spear with a curved blade. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

concept.name: kyudo
concept.definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo bow and arrows, sometimes called Japanese archery. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

concept.name: kabaddi
concept.definition: The attacking side scores by touching, and the side to guard scores by capturing. The attacker continues calling it "kabaddi".

concept.name: sepak takraw
concept.definition: The game like volleyball which must not use a hand. The ball made of rattan is used. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

concept.name: wushu
concept.definition: Generally, Chinese traditional martial art. (Programme of National Sports Festival in Japan)

concept.name: unrest, conflicts and war
concept.definition: Acts of socially or politically motivated protest and/or violence.

concept.name: act of terror
concept.definition: Act of violence, often deadly, designed to raise fear and anxiety in a population

concept.name: armed conflict
concept.definition: Disputes between opposing groups involving the use of weaponry, but not formally declared a war

concept.name: civil unrest
concept.definition: Dissatisfaction among the general population as evidenced by rallies, strikes, demonstrations or sabotage

concept.name: revolutions
concept.definition: An often violent change in a nation's system of government by internal forces that results in systematic social change.

concept.name: rebellions
concept.definition: Armed uprising by citizens of a nation with the intent to overthrow the government, without necessarily achieving social change

concept.name: political dissent
concept.definition: Disagreement between political groups, usually organized and sometimes resulting in imprisonment of the dissenters

concept.name: religious conflict
concept.definition: Conflicts involving religious differences

concept.name: social conflict
concept.definition: Conflicts involving social differences

concept.name: coup d'etat
concept.definition: The overthrow of an established government by an organized group, often the military or a political party

concept.name: guerrilla activity
concept.definition: Anti-government actions by clandestine groups using hit-and-run techniques or sabotage, kidnapping and the like

concept.name: bioterrorism
concept.definition: Use of biological agent to raise the level of fear within a population, whether deaths occur or not.

concept.name: bombings
concept.definition: Use of explosive devices against people, buildings or structures

concept.name: massacre
concept.definition: The death of a large group of people over a brief period of time

concept.name: genocide
concept.definition: Systematic killing of one clan, tribe or ethnic type by another

concept.name: riots
concept.definition: Violent, destructive demonstrations often involving injury to individuals and destruction of property

concept.name: demonstration
concept.definition: A public show of feeling or opinion, as by a mass meeting or parade

concept.name: war
concept.definition: A formal declaration of hostilities by one country against another

concept.name: civil war
concept.definition: Armed conflict between members of the same nation or geographical region, in some cases with a desire to divide the nation or region.

concept.name: international military intervention
concept.definition: Temporary use of international forces by invitation or by a decision of an outside body in another country or region for the purpose of resolving a crisis.

concept.name: prisoners and detainees
concept.definition: People captured and imprisoned by their enemy during war or armed conflict

concept.name: conflict (general)
concept.definition: A dispute which can be at several levels,

concept.name: peacekeeping force
concept.definition: Varied national military forces under unified international command to maintain order in disputed areas.

concept.name: crisis
concept.definition: Conflict of all kinds that rises to a level where, depending on events, governments can fall, war be declared or stock markets crash, or not

concept.name: weaponry
concept.definition: Armaments of all types used to conduct war

concept.name: weather
concept.definition: The study, reporting and prediction of meteorological phenomena.

concept.name: forecast
concept.definition: Prediction of the course of the weather in the future either near term or long term

concept.name: global change
concept.definition: The determination whether the Earth is getting warm, or colder, whether seas are rising or falling and the like

concept.name: report
concept.definition: Any distributed announcement about the weather

concept.name: weather news
concept.definition: General information about weather events

concept.name: statistic
concept.definition: Numerical facts about the weather such as temperature, barometric pressure, river levels, humidity, high and low tides and the like

concept.name: warning
concept.definition: Alerts to the general populace about severe weather coming their way

concept.name: hip-hop
concept.definition: A contemporary urban music originating in the 1970s.

concept.name: soap opera
concept.definition: Episodic TV drama or saga, normally aired during daytime

concept.name: entertainment award
concept.definition: Awards for achievement in the entertainment industry, such as the Oscars for film, the Booker Prize for Literature, the Grammys for music, or induction into halls of fame.

concept.name: history
concept.definition: Issues connected with the past; discoveries, repair, conservation or display of artifacts; anniversaries of historic events

concept.name: terrorism
concept.definition: Violence against people to create fear in order to achieve political or ideological objectives

concept.name: execution
concept.definition: The carrying out of executions by a government or state, not by extralegal groups/organisations

concept.name: inquest
concept.definition: Formal investigation of sudden or unexpected death and the hearing to decide cause of death.

concept.name: inquiry
concept.definition: Formal hearing involving a disaster, political event etc. Eg rail crash, drug prescription scandal.

concept.name: tribunal
concept.definition: Formal hearing usually involving employment issues, property etc.

concept.name: rescue
concept.definition: An operation to save people, animals or property from harm or danger.

concept.name: primary care physician
concept.definition: Patient's basic health care doctor - first point of call for all health related problems

concept.name: health-workers union
concept.definition: Issues involving industry groups for doctors, nurses, health workers etc.

concept.name: patient
concept.definition: Issues which affect population in general as attendees at hospitals or doctors' surgeries.

concept.name: fortune-telling
concept.definition: The forecasting of future events or the delineation of character by methods not ordinarily considered to have a rational basis

concept.name: death
concept.definition: The human interest aspects of the demise of a person

concept.name: funeral
concept.definition: The ceremony to intern the remains of a person

concept.name: estate bestowal
concept.definition: The distribution of the estate of a person according to their will and any disagreements between the heirs

concept.name: memorial
concept.definition: Commemorative ceremony or object - plaque, statue etc - in remembrance of a person.

concept.name: plant
concept.definition: An organism of the kind exemplified by trees, shrubs, grasses, ferns, and mosses, typically growing in a permanent site

concept.name: shogi
concept.definition: A strategic board games which is native to Japan and is often called Japanese chess

concept.name: DIY
concept.definition: DIY - do it yourself. Normally the construction, repair or maintenance of residential property by an amateur

concept.name: shopping
concept.definition: Consumer purchasing and related trends, but not the business aspects of retailing

concept.name: gardening
concept.definition: The non-commercial aspects of landscaping, growing plants, trees and other vegetation that gives pleasure to the gardener and others

concept.name: adventure
concept.definition: Expeditions, daring feats, exploration, record-breaking, risk-associated events

concept.name: beauty
concept.definition: Issues relating to improving one's appearance and attractiveness, including reviews of beauty products

concept.name: consumer issue
concept.definition: Shopping, products for the home, relevant surveys, product recalls

concept.name: wedding
concept.definition: The marriage ceremony and the events that surround it - showers, rehearsal, parties, honeymoon, etc.

concept.name: international relations
concept.definition: Non-violent relations between nations through negotiation, treaty, or personal meetings

concept.name: peace negotiations
concept.definition: Negotiations intended to bring an end to a conflict

concept.name: alliances
concept.definition: Coalitions of like-minded groups formed to present a stronger force against any challenges

concept.name: death penalty policies
concept.definition: National or international polices regarding death sentences

concept.name: snooker
concept.definition: Two players using a cue and a white ball to "sink" other coloured balls in a correct order on a baize table and to cause an opponent to miss-hit by positioning the white ball in an inappropriate place - snookering.

concept.name: darts
concept.definition: Two players compete by throwing metal darts at a wall-mounted circular board divided radially into segments of different scores

concept.name: bodybuilding
concept.definition: A person displays pronounced muscle tone and exaggerated muscle mass and definition for overall aesthetic effect

concept.name: sports disciplinary action
concept.definition: Actions, including fines and suspensions levied by sports organisations and teams

concept.name: sports awards
concept.definition: Awards and honors given by sports organisations or won by sports figures
